title: Student Alumni Assistant  Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA)
Interview Descriptions: The position was listed as available on a student portal for campus resources, so I confirmed my interest in the part time job and was offered a chance to meet an interviewer at school. A group interview meeting was set up in an office between myself, a PR representative, an Alumni relations team member, and a direct supervisor of alumni communications.
Interview Questions: Please tell us a bit about yourself, your interests, skills, and reasons for applying to the opening.

title: Career Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: one phone screen with the manager and one in-person interview with the hiring team. Basic behavioral questions and get-to-know-you style of questioning. No technical component or presentation required. There were 4 people on the hiring team and I met with all of them in a panel style interview
Interview Questions: Tell me about your background.

title: Student Aide Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: Standard questions in a 30 minute interview. Not too bad, they reach out a few weeks later about the answer. Describe a time you experienced and resolved conflict. After that they train you and you watch online videos.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you experienced and resolved conflict.

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA)
Interview Descriptions: I drove onto campus and sat down, with a nice young lady, she asked about me and my availability. That was the meat and potatoes of it not the craziest interview for a student worker position.
Interview Questions: What does you availability look like with classes.

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA)
Interview Descriptions: They were very friendly asked questions about myself. Asked to summarize how to perform a qPCR. They never made me feel too stressed and appeared to be very understanding. They were open to discussing salary
Interview Questions: Walk us through how you perform qPCR

title: Nurse Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Panel interviews, with multiple people physicians, NPs, psychologists etc, took a long time to hear back had to follow up several times with admin. Overall long process. Not sure what else to add
Interview Questions: Tell me about your past experience

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Goes very well depending on what's your learnt, such as the knowledge based on your major and the paper you submitted on publican, and test how your knowldegd based on this job, i would highly recommand this job for you for the best experience.
Interview Questions: how you design the breadboard circuit?

title: Sandwich Artist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Really casual sit down chat with the student lead mostly regarding availability. Wanted someone who didn’t care too much about taking either early morning or late night shifts/ could work weekends.
Interview Questions: What days are you available?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: In summary hectic! I had to sponsor myself to one of the interview location and met twice virtually afterwards. This might not represent the general view, but there appear to be a bias in the employment process. People from high-ranked schools might have greater chances of being favored.
Interview Questions: Why did you apply? What are your career goals? What are your research plan for this project?

title: RNC Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Difficult as they were not always available at the same time and kept changing dates and times for interviews. Accommodations were difficult for them to have as someone was always out on vacation or not available.
Interview Questions: Last position as a nurse facility

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA)
Interview Descriptions: emailed along my resume, scheduled my interview, went there next week and started the interview immediately. only one round of questions with basic resume go over and questions related to research
Interview Questions: questions regarding lab and research procedures, past work experiences

title: Financial Analyst 3 Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: Was very lengthy due to being in their hiring system and then waiting for an opportunity to arise. Was in contact with the HR Recruiting department for over 3 months with opportunities that arose. After finally being considered for something along my career path, I was considered and the interview process actually was about 3 to 4 weeks and was contacted for the position when another candidate dropped out for consideration.
Interview Questions: Q: Have you had experience with systems such as Oracle or Excel in the past? Q: What kind of financial analysis have you performed in the past? Q: How do you communicate with your coworkers regarding deadlines and projects? Q: Do you have extensive knowledge/experience in both finance and accounting?

title: Operations Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed for multiple jobs at UCSD. Always made it to finalist category, But job always went to internal candidates. I have many years of experience working at UCSD in the past and was encouraged to continue to apply and always told that I interviewed very well.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position? How does it fit in with your career goals? Tell us about your background and experience and how it relates to this position.

title: Supplemental Instruction Leader Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: The first step is filling out the application. Then if your resume stands out you will be invited to the interview for the course you wanna support. You will be asked on a bunch of behavioral questions by different people (group interview). At last you need to take a test on the course you wanna support
Interview Questions: How do you write a certain function in matlab

title: UIA Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: I filled out a written application with a few essay questions such as 'Why do you want to be a UIA', that I submitted online. There was no phone or technical interview.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Communications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: Straightforward process. Interviewers are personable and ask questions to get to know you and your unique experiences versus sticking to the usual interview questions. Consistent updates regarding the process of the application.
Interview Questions: Situation-based questions, be prepared to give examples of how you handle particular situations and how you have changed your approach to projects when running into obstacles.

title: Billing Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: Employer was very friendly and are willing to be flexible on work schedule. There process for hiring takes up to 3 weeks so be patient or do not give your current employer notice until you receive a hire date.
Interview Questions: A description of previous work

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: For my department, it was 1 on 1 with one of the professors. They asked me a several questions, talked about what they do, and explained what my responsibilities will be.
Interview Questions: What are your goals after you graduate?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: It was good and good So awesome I wanna work there again and again. I highly recommend there. Students wanna work forever. I wanna work forever ever. Can I ? I really wanna work.
Interview Questions: What is your name? What is your major? What is your GPA?

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: My PI was sweet but stern when she needed to be. The interview process with her basically included questions about your work ethic and your personality. Most look for a well-rounded person who can adapt quickly and is also able to work independently.
Interview Questions: How well do you work under pressure or during a time crunch?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: A straightforward process and standard questions were asked of me. Not much experience needed for this position, just be a self starter and communicate openly with the interviewer and make sure you fit the culture of the lab you're interviewing for.
Interview Questions: What are you interested in?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: I applied through the University of California application with personal statements, transcript, recommendation letters, etc. I also reached out to professors to ask about research and how my background and work aligns with theirs.
Interview Questions: They asked about my educational background.

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Diego in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: I was invited to interview for a CRC position at UCSD, but unfortunately, the interview was cancelled by the employer the day before the scheduled date. While I understand that they may have found better candidates, I do not believe that cancelling an interview at such short notice is a professional way to handle the situation. They should have evaluated all applicants thoroughly before reaching out and inviting me to a interview.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego in Feb 2023
Interview Descriptions: The interview process at UC San Diego is somewhat lengthy. However, it is due to many qualified candidates, and the current job search climate in San Diego makes is very competitive.
Interview Questions: What are your top three best qualities?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: The interview process can vary depending on the company and the position being applied for, but generally, it consists of several stages: Application: The first step is typically submitting an application, either through the company's website or a job board.
Interview Questions: Behavioral Questions: These questions are designed to help the interviewer understand how you have handled situations in the past. Example: "Tell me about a time when you had to solve a difficult problem at work." Technical Questions: These questions are designed to evaluate your knowledge and skills related to the job. Example: "Can you explain how you would go about troubleshooting a network issue?" Situational Questions: These questions are designed to

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: apply through UCSD web, upload your resume and your personal statement. Also your transcript, english test score and answer some questions. Most importantly, make sure let your referrers upload your recommendation letters.
Interview Questions: How does Covid-19 impact your life.

title: Landscaping Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: Pretty friendly interview. Not a lot of pressure. Interviewer was nice and it seems like they need a lot of help. There is a Covid booster requirement for this job.
Interview Questions: Experience working with landscaping tools.

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Search committee of staff, faculty and students (45m) followed by a direct interview with staff (45m) via Zoom. Questions were high in number and read off of a script/list. Neither interview left much space for discussion or follow-up questions.
Interview Questions: Examples of working in student affairs Theory/knowledge base for staying up to date in current trends Discuss a program

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: The interview was a long process. Much longer than I had anticipated. From submitting my application to the interview took about a month, Then approximately another month until I received the offer letter through HR.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: I didn’t had a regular process but I was asked to join the team while I worked on the mutual research project. So there is nothing to say to be helpful about the process.
Interview Questions: There was no specific questions but I was offered during the project.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: Generic grad school interview process. You chat with the PI that you are interested in. They ask you about your undergrad research experience and they introduce what they are currently working on. They also ask your current research interest.
Interview Questions: Talk about past research experiences and future research interest.

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: Initial interview is casual with one person then 3 panel interview is a bit more pressured with rotating questions from each person. Be prepared to “sell yourself”. Also have a few questions for them ready
Interview Questions: How do you handle stress?

title: Trainer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UC San Diego in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions: Was invited for a first interview (screener) via Zoom. It was suggested that information about next steps would be shared within a few weeks and it's now been months with no communication one way or another.
Interview Questions: Why are you the best candidate for this job?

title: Student Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Diego in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was very low-stress compared to other jobs, particularly because this was for a student position. I am unsure how it went for me personally though, since I have not yet received their decision, and I think it is really competitive. Many students are always looking for lab positions, so I'm not sure where I stand in this.
Interview Questions: They asked what I was most interested in, as this was a psychology lab, so they wanted to know what particular areas of psychology I care about. It was for a mental health lab, so of course they want to know what my interest in mental health is.

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: Highly structured interview with multi-part questions requiring answers that provide examples. Be prepared to give examples of scenarios that describe how you accomplished a goal, managed a team, overcame an obstacle, etc
Interview Questions: Tell us about your career path and how it has led you to this position?

title: Physician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: You had to go through a match proocess where you rank your favorite programs. The program then also makes a rank list and an algorithm decides where you end up.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: No interview for graduate admission. Writing a statement of purpose, personal statment and a resume Get recommendation letters Get TOFEL score and GRE score Make a portfolio presenting projects and research etc
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: Had one interview that lasted about 30 minutes. Pretty basic questions regarding the position and my past experience. 2 interviewers who were both kind. Wanted to make the process easy for me.
Interview Questions: Why is punctuality important at work?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: It was tough, but once you pass it, you will get accepted. And you need to prepare for a while for the interview. You will get some tough questions once you get pass that, you will be fine.
Interview Questions: what you can bring it on the table for the school?

title: Credential Evaluator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: I was hired as a temp before transitioning to FT but the interview process took about a month due to having to interview with HR initially, then finalizing paperwork, and finally being placed into a role. Once placed, I started within the same week.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at UCSD?

title: Staff Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions: Professor scheduled an interview, and options were by soon or at the lab. I went for a presencial interview and it was very nice. Professor gave the tour to his lab and introduced me to the team members. Interview lasted for about 1 hour.
Interview Questions:
Overview about my research background.
Career expectations, and how can I contribute to the lab.

title: SRAI Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very straightforward. Interviewed by a PI and 2 graduate students over zoom. The questions were as would be expected, interviewees would benefit by showing a genuine interest in the research focus of the lab, even if their knowledge of the material/topic is lacking.
Interview Questions: Describe your previous research experience, Describe your previous lab experiences

title: CSE Instructional Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Aug 2022
Interview Descriptions: Resume + questions application followed by a potential interview with the professor instructing the course. Behavioral + questions relating to the content that the course is on. Especially difficult for lower division classes such as CSE 8A, CSE 8B, CSE 11, CSE 12, and CSE 30. Applying to most upper division classes will be easier as long as you understand the content.
Interview Questions: What is the different between a Java class and a Java interface?

title: Senior Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Jul 2022
Interview Descriptions: The interview was a panel with multiple members. I just had one interview. They asked questions in a round-robin style, with time for my questions at the end. The overall process, from application to offer, took a very long time.
Interview Questions: What are my strengths and weaknesses

title: Supplemental Instruction Leader Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: After you submit the application online, the supervisor will reach out to you if you are qualified for the position. There was only one round of interview and it was a quick one.
Interview Questions: The interview questions mostly relate to classes you've taken and what experience you have with tutoring.

title: Problem Loan Administration Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: After applying they contacted me within two days and then schedule an interview. they first describe and introduce the job, and then an introduction, general question, and behavioral questions. There were 4 interviewers.
Interview Questions: what is your greatest strength? If there are you and other three candidates, why should we choose you?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: There are rounds of interviews that focus on leadership and diversity experiences. There may also be hypothetical situations. Be sure to have examples ready. There is a different interview for returning staff.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a conflict between apartment-mates?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: Casual interview for entry level position out of undergrad. There was no stress and they just want to ensure you have basic experimental skills and ability to think rationally. Got to meet the PI and team as well as explore the lab and it’s resources.
Interview Questions: What lab experience do you have?

title: CX Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: Very straight forward and open interview. To leave a mark have a story that exhibits the traits they are looking for.  Everything can be taught, the most important thing is being able to demonstrate enthusiasm and curiosity.
Interview Questions: Why would you like to work here?

title: Journal Writer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: Much of the application was held online and interviews are in person. If you pass the initial pass then you can get an interview with recruiters who ask you several questions.
Interview Questions: Q. What writing experience did you have

title: Communications Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: Met in-person with an interview panel and then had to do a writing assessment. Took them a while to get back to me on whether or not I got the job (I didn't) but overall was a good experience.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with difficult clients?

title: Business Systems Analyst II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Apr 2022
Interview Descriptions: 4 Interviewers, two technical engineers, one business analyst, and manager.  Zoom interview and the process was pretty straight forward. Provided backgrounds of each interviewer. It was an hour to two hour interview. Each person went through their questions.
Interview Questions: Project management experiences and how was it used.

title: PhD Student, Biology Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: PhD interviews here are very similar to other schools. You will meet with 3-5 PIs and be asked about your research and they will likely tell you about their research (if they don't get that ball rolling, you should definitely ask!). Various presentations about living in San Diego, research ongoing here and what grad students are up to.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to come to UCSD for grad school?

title: Public Health Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: Very smooth, quick and easy. Got back to me very fast and the questions were appropriate. They asked me questions about my ability to travel, what my research experience was.
Interview Questions: How do you prioritize tasks?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: Easy going interviewer who kept asking basic questions to get to know you and your strengths/weaknesses. There were a few situational questions also. I had a phone interview and had to go to an in-person one. Overall, it was easy and straightforward.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with stressful situations?

title: Equipment Room Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: 2 rounds of interviews, very light and kind interviewers made me feel at ease. I would just to be engaging and do your regular preparations. Be sure to ask ​ questions at the end.
Interview Questions: They asked me about one of my achievements on my resume out of interest.

title: Student Driver Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: Reviews driving record and any infractions you may have received during any point of your driving career. They also review basic safety practices when driving carts on-campus. Questions about how much and often you drive are a larger part of the interview.
Interview Questions: If a student asked you to drive faster on campus, what would you do?

title: Ophthalmic Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed and given a tour. I was given the opportunity to ask questions and spent about 1 hour total. You must pay for parking when going to the interview.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job?

title: Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was too good. one of the best university across to be placed. I hope to get into the organization successfully. proud to be apart of this and they are one the best
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Marketing and Communications Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: 2 interviews that ask you about your prior experience and ask for a portfolio of your marketing materials as well as experience with digital are and graphic design. They really try and get to know you and see if you are a fit
Interview Questions: Tell us about your past experience

title: Business Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: First had a phone call with hiring manager, video group call with hiring manager, lead, and person not  on immediate team, then had a final interview with a few team members
Interview Questions: Tell me about a project you worked on that went well?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: One easy interview with the supervisor. She asked mostly behavioral questions and availability, with a few about why I would want this job. She was very kind and only took 30 minutes.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this position

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at UC San Diego in Jan 2022
Interview Descriptions: informative, challenging and nice people. seems like a good benefits and overall culture. great questions asked to better get to know me. i enjoyed getting to know how the program works and they answered my questions happily.
Interview Questions: Experience and how I handle challenges

title: Equipment Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Diego (Fairbanks, AK) in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions: good they ask why would I want to do this job and why should they choose me, and they really need people that time so I am in. I think the questions are pretty straight forward and it was on zoom too. 2 rounds
Interview Questions: why would I want to do this job why should they choose me

title: Outback Adventures Guide Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: Friendly and straightforward. The interviewers acknowledge student difficulties and work-life balance. Communication is also great, they let you know exactly what and how to do what you need to do, training is provided. Work schedules are very flexible.
Interview Questions:
Past experience that would help in this position?
How do you go about resolving workplace conflict?

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: It was okay. At first, they asked questions about ourselves, then proceeded on asking how we would lead a tutor session. We took turns answering as it was a group interview with two people.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a tutor?

title: Graduate Student Financial Support Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions:
Zoom format, virtual interview.
Round-robin, experiential questions, somewhat redundant.
Formal yet relaxed interactions.
Transparent with answers regarding position.
Friendly and kind  department representation.
One hour duration, on time to start and conclude.
Four person panel.
Enjoyable communication / interactions.
Detailed explanation of expectations and job requirements.
Interview Questions: What was my biggest challenge...

title: Lifeguard Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: Great, really was able to show my true potential. Was easy to prepare for and it was honestly really fun. I love working here so much. The interview process was easy.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job?

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: Emailed my resume as a student worker, and was immediately contacted and scheduled an interview with the PI. Depending on the PI, you will be asked the typical questions, but they are also very interested in pat work experiences, or involvement with any volunteer work, community based activities
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself, etc.

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Diego in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: Positive experience, decently easy questions. There was a mix of situational questions and other basic questions. Positive experience and good conversation. Asked about prior experience and current job role. Overall, I would say to focus on researching the hospital and the unit
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself; why do you want to work here

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: Very casual and friendly, the interview felt a lot more like a conversation than an interview which was refreshing. One short 30 minute Zoom call to chat about past experience and plans for the future, then received a decision via email ~1.5 weeks after.
Interview Questions: Background, plans for the future, elaborating on experience relating to labwork.

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: The interview was conducted over zoom and felt more like a conversation. I felt comfortable. I was asked about my prior experiences, what I wanted to learn, and my career goals
Interview Questions: What kind of projects do you see yourself doing

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: Mix of technical and behavioral questions, focus on lab techniques and past experience. Will ask about skills and experience listed on resume, will ask to describe previous projects you helped on
Interview Questions: How do you run a PCR?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was a part-time position. The process was really quick. I received an interview invitation at 9 pm and the interview was conducted 11 am next day. The interviewer asked a couple of brain anatomy questions.
Interview Questions: Which brain area involve the memory?

title: Senior Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was simple and straightforward, but also I was being interviewed internally which played a role. The questions that were asked were straightforward and not too unexpected. The interview was held through zoom with two interviewers present who gave a rundown of the process before getting started and took around 45 minutes.
Interview Questions: What strengths do you bring to this position and how does your previous experience prepare you for it?

title: ED Tech Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: Four people jumped on a zoom interview and each had scenario questions - there were about 13 scenarios that I had to answer. One asked about if I had to help with a CPR code what are 4 things I’d bring to the patient room.
Interview Questions: If there was a difficult patient who was frustrated how would you resolve it?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: There was a panel of interviewers that takes turns in giving questions. The interview itself lasted about 30-40 minutes. After that, the director of the department gave a tour of the office.
Interview Questions: What was my expertise in data analytics?

title: Supplemental Instruction Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: The process involves a group interview with only a couple other students that lasted a little under an hour. Also had to take a short quiz on the material you will be tutoring in.
Interview Questions: How would you engage students?

title: Lead Food Service Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Jul 2021
Interview Descriptions: Panel via Zoom. Three people alternated asking questions and then took notes on my responses. All pretty run of the mill questions. Took about 30 minutes total. Very thorough process; takes a while to get an offer.
Interview Questions: How to lead an inexperienced worker.

title: Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: This is a waste of time, just let me read interview questions. Thank you for making this so difficult to get help on my interview. What a time to be alive .
Interview Questions: Where have you taught before?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: Hour long with a scenario present to imitate a caller. General questions were asked. One question about if you were to relate this job to a class that you had, what would it be and why
Interview Questions: What are some strengths that you have and weaknesses.

title: Student Library Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: I had one interview that was inside of Geisel library. It was pretty short and casual. The manager met me at the door and showed me into the back, where the library management staff work, and we had a one-on-one interview in which he asked me a series of questions from a paper which were very standard interview questions for part-time work. I heard back a few days later.
Interview Questions: Are you organized and able to pay attention to detail?

title: Food Service Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: there was no formalized interview process. They just had me complete an in person onboarding/training on my first day and asked a few questions about how many hours id work a week.
Interview Questions: how many hours will you be working per week?

title: Client Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was fairly easy. I applied through the Temporary Employment portal. The recruiter did an interview with me and passed me on to the next team. Very easy and efficient process.
Interview Questions:
What kind of communications have you sent out

Have you worked with financial systems previously

title: Marketing & Communications Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: Very nice, they were very supportive and encouraging all throughout the interview process. Lots of communication back and forth and they never ghosted me. Very transparent and caring throughout! I think that this process went down very smoothly!
Interview Questions: Can you tell us about yourself

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: Very direct and concise, asked questions that pertained to the position in question and did not try to trick you. I really liked the interviewer, she was very polite. They were timely in their responses, and prompt to the meeting.
Interview Questions: How would you guide the student?

title: Postdoctoral Scholar Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: The interview was pretty standard for academia. Not much effort was put into the structure of the interview, but it seems like the interview greatly depends on the principal investigator.
Interview Questions: What do you want to get out of this position?

title: Career Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Very structured. Overly bureaucratic. Very standard questions and process oriented. I immediately sensed I would be joining a massive organization with all the pros and cons. That being said, the HR team was extremely responsive.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at University of California?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: Chill presentation to small team about past research experience. Usually phone interview with the PI first. The team discuss if they want you, and you hear from HR quite fast. The HR needs 6 references.
Interview Questions: Tell us your past research experience

title: Seventh College Summer Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was a zoom interview, a couple of personal questions, some about the seventh college and UCSD culture, and one location test.  After the interview, I had to wait a couple of days to receive an offer.
Interview Questions: What do you think about the Seventh College culture?

title: Plant Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: It was a panel interview with 5 people - pre-COVID. There was a range of personnel, from within the department and without. They took turns asking questions (which seemed to be from a master list). Everyone was very pleasant and the atmosphere was the same. I did get the sense that the manager had already made the hiring decision and they were just going through the motions - and that’s okay. It was good practice.
Interview Questions: The basics, plus more specific questions relating my experience to the job opening. They gave plenty of time to answer and also time at the end to ask them questions.

title: Sales Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: The interview was brief and the mood was casual.  Entire interview lasted no longer than fifteen minutes. Interviewer was kind and made you feel comfortable in their presence. You could tell the work environment was fast paced.
Interview Questions: What sales experience do you have?

title: Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed first with Director and then Hiring  Manager. A week after interviewing received an email from manager stating that they were preparing to give me an offer.  Provided references and then was ghosted.  Checked job status and it now says “Others more competitive”. Strange and unprofessional to never contact me to explain. Have shared my experience with others and definitely unacceptable process.
Interview Questions: Talked about projects worked on recently.  More of a discussion.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: It was very long. They asked many questions and looked increasingly dissatisfied by my responses but kept asking them. I was not offered the job in the end and did not even receive an email notifying me of this.
Interview Questions: Have you ever taught before?

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: I had a total of 3 interviews and a skills test - two panel interviews, one-on-one with the hiring manager, and a technical skill test. The entire process lasted one week. I had an offer the day after my skill test.
Interview Questions: The most difficult query I had written in SQL.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: One phone and one in persona interview. One was more personality, work environment focused and one was more content focused. Both asked scenario based questions towards the end of interview.
Interview Questions: What are the 3 most important things to you other than salary?

title: Loss Prevention Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: Long interview and very thorough. It was a panel of several people who asked many questions, some of which were uncomfortably personal. I was interviewed by the people I was going to work with.
Interview Questions: Tell us a joke, any joke

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: interview was simple and straight forward and I heard back relatively soon after the interview. Mostly asked about previous work experiences and other relevant skills. Overall interview questions were not too difficult
Interview Questions: What do you hope to gain from this position?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Mar 2021
Interview Descriptions:
1 online interview with managers and supervisor
Heard back the next day. Once hired, began work 2 weeks later. Great company to work at with great benefits, pay. Staff is great.
Interview Questions:
What are your strengths/weaknesses
A time you dealt with difficult patient 
Why should we hire you

title: Computer Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: They were very open with where my position was in the process and the interviewer started out explaining the salary and the position to me and made sure to answer any of my questions.
Interview Questions:
Where do you see yourself in five years? 
What makes you excited about this role?

title: Fiscal Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: Interviewing with the supervisors, brief 30 minute interview on campus. Asked basic interview questions and was offered a position at the end of the interview. Then took a tour around the office and had opportunity to ask questions.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and or weaknesses?

title: Senior Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: No formal interview process with HR. Interviewed briefly with PI and lab members in a very informal way. Didn’t hear back on hiring until several weeks after. Discovered that once an offer was made that I was not an official employee according to the University and was not paid for the first two days of being employed. Then discovered I was hired under an exception hire policy and was offered no benefits until passing a 6 month probationary period without agreeing to this is advance.
Interview Questions: Are you willing to do all aspects of lab work including cleaning.

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: Great interview process. Was thorough and I appreciated all of the question. They answered all of my questions as well. Good overall interview in comparison with other companies. I also appreciated the follow up with all of there questions. The questions were also in depth enough to tackle my experience.
Interview Questions: What is your favorite thing to do? How do you like to spend your offtime?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: It is virtual these days because of COVID. Probably few rounds of interviews. Invite is sent for zoom. Usually wait time between application which are applied on job site and then there is pre screen and then in person virtual interview happens.
Interview Questions: Conflict management and resolution and examples

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: I was asked to give a Seminar to the department, and was asked questions about seminar. They were friendly but dedicated to asking tough questions. Then I spoke directly with PI and some members of her team.
Interview Questions: Why do you feel you are suited for this position?

title: Career Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: 30 minute phone  screen interview with the hiring manager, then a 1 hour panel interview with the team including a presentation, 30 minute offer interview with the Asst. Dean and hiring manger to extend verbal offer
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work with us?

title: Data Analytics Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: Great interview. Was thorough and tested my analytical skills involving various problems, while also gauging my ability to answer questions both estimation related and behavioral. Overall, a very pleasant interview experience.
Interview Questions: Can you tell me about yourself?

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: a group interview with 3 other prospective candidates. A lot of typical surface level interview questions such as “what makes a good leader” and “what are your strengths/weaknesses” overall, it took about 15 minutes
Interview Questions: “What makes a good leader”

title: CSE 12 Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: Submit application followed by an interview with the current staff including tutors. After the interview you are sent out to wait for a response via email some time later. Usually no word if you are not accepted, only receive word if you got the job.
Interview Questions: Basic CSE 12 course knowledge

title: Principal Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Friendly, open, curious, organized. It involved 3 stages with different panels. It included a panel of the team members too so team can weigh in. It involved auditions to demonstrate skills along multiple dimensions.
Interview Questions: What trends are you following in your field?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was quite simple and straightforward. Had basic interview questions that are more subjective than objective.  Took no longer than 30 minutes. Be prepared with potential answers to common interview questions but don't forget to be yourself.
Interview Questions:
1. tell me about yourself
2. why do you want to work here.

title: Sales Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC San Diego (New York, NY) in Jan 2021
Interview Descriptions: it was short, fun, and was asked many questions about the  role and everything that it entailed for working. I like the interview process and had  a good time  overall
Interview Questions: why how what where why

title: Family Medicine Physician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: Fair interview process,  ask important questions, not intimating. Want to know about your interests and goals. Do their best to suit you up in an appropriate location with a fitting MA. Would like to know if you are a good fit for the company personally which I find very valuable.
Interview Questions: What are your goals in family medicine.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: By department, they will post job and requirements, and you apply via department. They will read the CV and recommendation letter and email you if accepted. Interview tends to be by faculty members.
Interview Questions: Why you want to be a teaching assistant?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and got a call to set a date for an online interview.  Was emailed and date a time for a zoom meeting. Panel interview online and all asked questions. All done via Zoom.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your career journey?

title: Lab Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Highly dependent on the lab and PI.  Lab PI asked me standard questions, including prior work experience and familiarity with their lab research. There were no trick questions or on-the-spot tasks for me to complete. Overall a pleasant interview experience for students like me that suffer from interview anxiety.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself. What experience do you have?

title: R&D Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: There were 2 Interviews. The first one was mainly related to my experience and background and the second was related more specifically to the job and what I wold be doing.
Interview Questions:
What laboratory experience do you have?
Do you have experience with contamination?

title: Post Graduate Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions:
I was contacted after applying via email. 
The meeting was through zoom, I was asked some questions and then was given time to ask the interviewer some questions. The interviewer had given me a list of their previous publications for me to review prior to our interview.
Interview Questions: I was asked about my previous research experience, projects, hardships I faced, how I overcame them. There were also some questions regarding the details of the protocols I used and why I changed them.

title: Practice Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: Staff is informative and courteous during the actual interview.  However, the recruitment process is exceedingly long and you are unaware of where you are in the process.  I did not think I had advanced because so much time elapsed between the initial interview and any follow up.
Interview Questions: What has been your experience with hiring/firing employees?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: I was in a group interview for a dining hall position. They asked me about how I would balance school with the position as well as my solutions to hypothetical problems.
Interview Questions: What would you do if a customer asks you a question you do not know the answer to.

title: Library Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA)
Interview Descriptions: A short phone interview about how I heard about the position opening and why I was interested. This was followed by a scheduled in person interview. After the interview I have my availability.
Interview Questions:
How would you handle a disgruntled or angry patron?

What relevant customer service experience do you have that would translate to your duties here?

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was thorough and yet very pleaseant. The atmosphere was friendly and I felt comfortable. I felt they were genuinely interested in learning about me and how I might fit into their team.
Interview Questions: They asked me why I wanted to work at UCSD.

title: SC&A Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: there are usually three people interviewing you. Ask general questions about your experience with the library and other things.  They also want to know your ability to handle fragile materials. They are very friendly and overall great interview experience.
Interview Questions: What are your experiences using the Library Catalog?

title: Mobile Developer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: Simple and to the point. Relevant questions and understanding hiring manager. Expect a lengthy interview process for something like the ITS Help Desk. Reasonable interview process depending on the role.
Interview Questions: How would you implement a card-based UI in React Native?

title: On Campus Job Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: First of all, they selected 3 people in the Zoom meeting, the interviewer asked us to introduce ourselves and then will ask some easy behavioral questions. I applied for the market job, so the questions are all related to the work ethic and whether you are a team based players, such like that.
Interview Questions: What do you do when you find a thief in the market?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: talk about past research experience, why this group, do you have other offer deadlines, introduce the research project ongoing in the group, it's more like a conversation and behavior interview to see if you will fit the role. not very hard, be confident
Interview Questions: tell me about your past experience? why this group? do you have offer deadlines?

title: Informational Technology Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: Lengthy, initial phone call interview then in person interview. Mock interviews were about troubleshooting issues with devices and connecting to networks. First was walking through the user to connecting to the internet as nd troubleshooting the issue.
Interview Questions: How familiar are you with various software troubleshooting

title: Business Data Analyst (Student) Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: Relaxed environment. They just want to see your fit with the team and whether you have a basic idea of analytics. A lot of what you are learning will be on the job. They don't expect too much from you but you need to be eager. This is a great place to work at and provides lots of flexibility.
Interview Questions: Look at this visualized data (basic graphs and charts). What are your most interesting findings from this?

title: Staff Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: Informal and brief.  Wish it was more formal and extensive. HR was helpful in answering most of my questions. Application process was long,  but not sure if due to COVID.
Interview Questions: There weren't many questions besides standard questions.

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: we didnt have an interview. as far as I recall I just got the letter in the (e)mail saying I got in. the asked me to have some recommendation letters and transcripts.
Interview Questions: during the application process they wanted to know about my pursuits and how the PhD would be a good fit for me. if you dont have a reason to do a PhD, don't do one.

title: Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: Quick, easy, basic. There were no surprises  and it was what I expected. They asked general questions, teamwork, let me ask questions. It was a panel of nurse managers and was not very structured.
Interview Questions: experience

title: Machine Shop Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Jun 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview was asking if you know how to clean and maintain in a bigger framework. They also ask for if you would like to have a learning experience based on the shop.
Interview Questions: What did you want out of this job?

title: Peer Coach Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at UC San Diego in May 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview was a MMI format (multiple mini interview). There are also stations with different coaches where you act out scenarios, answer general behavioral questions, and the why you want to be involved as a peer coach.
Interview Questions: What would you do if a student came to you and said that they felt unmotivated?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: It was an online interview and it was timed to 45 seconds to a minute. It was also very vague questions like how many planes fly in the world in one day.
Interview Questions: They asked the connection of my Undergrad major to my Master's Degree.

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Diego in Apr 2020
Interview Descriptions: it will have the Kira interview at first. you should pay attention to the market size question and practice some normal questions. it is not difficult but you should do it
Interview Questions: how to calculate the fish in the sea

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions:
1 interview the manager of the group
The manager checked my references
Brought 5 copies of my resume and it came in handy because it was a panel interview
Got the job a week later
Interview Questions: How do you manage to do work you that be very tedious and dull at times

title: Busser Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: The dude the guy man dude, he, literally just asked me my availability. There were no standard interview questions. It was very chill. He just looked at my classes and asked me what times I'd like to work.
Interview Questions: Availability/class schedule

title: Business Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: The initial interview was with 4 people. It was well organized and each person was taking notes based upon the answers I provided. The layout of the interview was provided to me at the beginning of the interview and they left 5 minutes at the end for me to ask any questions that I had.
Interview Questions: Have you ever had to deliver bad news to a leadership team?

title: Summer Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: It was thorough and they were very professional with how they went with it, they were very fair and inclusive. They ask you about yourself so that they can see if you fit.
Interview Questions: What are your greatness strengths?

title: Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in Dec 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview was conducted via Zoom with a Professor. The duration was about 15-20 minutes and it was a back and forth on the Professor's lab work and my own experiences. If things are progressing well, the professor will ask what project you wanted to work with them on.
Interview Questions: What projects have you worked on?

title: Sales Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: Fast and easy, asked simple questions of certain scenarios. You have to apply online in order to get an interview. They will call you to come in. Interview with the boss and supervisor. They are all friendly.
Interview Questions: What is a Challenge you had to face

title: Research and Design Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: Applied on SIO website and was contacted a few weeks after. They personally emailed me and gave me dates/times for my interview. I selected a choice, then I came down, I got a small tour of the lab and then was interviewed by four people simultaneously. Everyone was very chill and nice.
Interview Questions: Have you had any experience with version control?

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: Quick, straight forward interview. Asked about my previous experience, how well I work with others, and what I thought about the job description. The interviewers were friendly and positive.
Interview Questions: How do you deal with problems with a customer?

title: Ra Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: not a formal interview, just a short talk about my projects and introduce what I need to learn. I talked with him for a while, and I think that was a good talk. The expected time was 30 min, but we talked for an hour
Interview Questions: something about my projects

title: Lab Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: I applied online for the job and was contacted a couple of weeks later for an interview. The interview was a 1 on 1 with the PI and went well. After the interview, I got no response to any follow-up emails I had sent. I sent a thank you email (because I was told a decision would be made in about 5 days) and an email to check in about a week later to check if any decisions had been made. I received no response to either and still have not been contacted about a decision almost 3 weeks after the interview.
Interview Questions: Describe your diving experience? (This lab does research involving SCUBA diving)

title: Faculty Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: submit a proposal along with a diversity statement and statement of teaching philosophy.  Must have previous employers submit letters of recommendation.  Next step is usually a phone interview but can also be a video conference call. standardized questions amongst candidates.  then comes an in person interview
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at SIO

title: Graduate Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: You apply to grad school like you would at any other college except this time you need to specifically solicit research professors in the department you'd like to work with.  I corresponded via email until they invited me to visit the campus to meet with professors in person.
Interview Questions: What kind of research experience did you do during your undergrad education.

title: Academic Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: Easy online system, notifies you when moved on to next portion of hiring. First step is "Application Recevied" then it may go to "Referred to Hiring Department" if your cover letter and resume pass the basic screening check. Once it is referred to hiring, the program will contact you directly if interested or want an interview. Once notified of the interview process your status will switch. If there is no interview, the status may say "others more competitive" or "position filled" or "position cancelled"
Interview Questions: How does your experience and career goals apply to this role?

title: Communications Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UC San Diego in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: Usually in 2-4 rounds, with supervisors and team. Pretty standard interview questions. They'll also ask you to share any past work you've done, what your experience is in working with students, and especially students with marginalized backgrounds.
Interview Questions: Describe a conflict you've worked through with your team.

title: Post Doc Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: I wrot eemail to PI for whom I wanted tro work, than after 2-3 days I received emaiI with additional questions and references. After sending references and contact details to these references , in next week I was interviewed by skype.
Interview Questions: about PhD experience and research

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: The interview was a brief and informal interview with the managers. They mostly wanted to hear about my previous nursing experience. It was casual and not intimidating. This was followed up with a brief tour of the unit.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Designer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: Pretty easy and straight forward. This was for a student job so I didn't necessarily get grilled on any tough subjects. One phone interview and then an in person interview. After that I got the offer about a week later.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a project that you have worked on and explain to me your design process?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: Dining services interviews students in batches. Everyone is hired. Wear whatever you want. Someone was wearing basketball shorts and a T-shirt. Staff is nice. Ask nicely and they will give you the placement you want.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for HDH?

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: It began very casual with a walk through of the lab and nice chat with the lab manager and ended in a room where 7 people sat around me and asked highly specific questions about the lab equipment.
Interview Questions: Have you ever worked with a mouse colony?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: Phone screen and in-person interview. In-person interview was a panel of two people asking questions back and forth. Upbeat vibe and positive throughout the process, was quick to get back to me about the outcome of the interview.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in the next five years?

title: Plant Accountant Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was a panel interview of four people, two of which were from different, but related departments. All were very pleasant, and they took turns asking questions from a script. I fully appreciate that there were likely other meetings scheduled following my interview, but I felt rushed toward the end, and it was plainly obvious that the position’s supervisor was done, even before I had a chance to ask my questions. Having taken the time to meet with them personally (and follow up with a thank you), I expected the minimum of a “No, thanks”. There was nothing.
Interview Questions: What three words best describe customer service?

title: Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: Professional and polite. Returned calls quickly. Concise and clear on explanation of job duties and interview processes. Overview of skills and duties from experience on resume. Discussed how daily role works. Explored specific duties and ask details on care management in acute care setting and SW referral processes.
Interview Questions: How would you address discharge plan for patient from acute care facility?

title: SFSW Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: Group interview where they go through a cycle of questions. The process is rather informal and the questions are straightforward. Virtually everyone that gets an interview gets hired, however not necessarily at the preferred location.
Interview Questions: How would you balance work and school?

title: Ingeniero Mecánico Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: Se comportaron de una manera muy cordial y profesional al ponerse en contacto con migo pues apreciaron mis conocimientos y actitudes que tengo para el puesto, al inicio de la entrevista fue un poco rápido y aguil la entrevista pues se pueden apreciar la amplia capacitación del personal al resivir a los postulados para empleados de la compañía.
Interview Questions: Mis conocimientos y grado de estudios

title: Recreation Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at UC San Diego in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: Wait at the lobby and somebody will escort you, usually the manager, to the lobby. Interview process itself was pretty simple. Look over your resume and ask details on that. Ask what you like to do as a hobby, for a fun question, and then they ask why you want this job.
Interview Questions: What is your favorite workout equipment.

title: Grounds Maintenance Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: Asked when I was available and if I was comfortable with the labor to be done. It took place at the gym and was informal. Afterwards they asked the earliest I could start working.
Interview Questions: How are you in a group setting?

title: Operations Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at UC San Diego in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: There was only one non technical interview, just behavioral. It was like I was having a conversation about myself and the university. This is also a part time position so they asked for my availability. I got an email later that day saying I got the job.
Interview Questions:
Why do you want the job?
What are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Research Assistant Interview

title: Student Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in Dec 2017
Interview Descriptions: Was invited to meet with the PI & a couple of grad students. Everyone was extremely friendly and the interview itself was pretty lax. The whole interview lasted about 20-30 minutes; definitely come with questions, they're here to help you and make sure that this experience is as beneficial for you as it is for them!

title: Digital Media and Social Fundraiser Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA)
Interview Descriptions:
Three interviews over the course of two and a half hours - two panels and a one-on-one. Intensive to say the least, but I did well. Everyone was friendly and welcoming. Where the negative experience comes into play is what happened with the followup. I sent out my thank yous to the immediate department members who I had interviewed with. None of them acknowledged me but that's okay. The department head, who made herself a point of contact in the whole process, ignored my additional followup requests over the next few weeks. Flat-out ignored me. Eventually I wrote to someone else and I received a bizarre response, that the "offer was still in process," whatever that means. 

A week or two after that contact I received a generic blanket rejection e-mail that opened with "Dear Applicant." Obviously it was BCC'd to everyone else. I wasted two and a half hours of my time being probed here only to be duly ignored and then addressed as "applicant." I would think that with such an intensive interview process there would be a little more class involved when communicating with applicants. The department head also accused me of being a perfectionist during our interview. Nope, not a perfectionist; I just have high standards, which is something that this whole process completely lacked.

UCSD does great work, but I would hope it's not like this in other departments. Very poorly handled here.
Interview Questions: What are you most proud of in your career?
