Interview Questions: How much free time do you have?

title: Study Abroad Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: One interview, in-person, though Skype was offered as an alternative. They provided a parking space and the HR recruiter met me at my car. The entire interview was less than an hour. Though I didn't get the position, the hiring manager called to let me know, AND did it before the weekend. I have never experienced such kindness and consideration by a hiring office or university.
Interview Questions: What attracted you to the position? How does it fit into your short & long term goals?

title: Food Service Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interview was a panel/group type interview so expect to be interviewed by at least 2 individuals, and to be in a group of other students. Questions are easy if you already had food working experience or retail experience.
Interview Questions: What were one of your greatest achievements at your previos job?

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Apply online, choose 5 courses you want to tutor in , get email from the office, and get contacted by the instructor for further step if required. You may also have to take additional 2 unit course.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: ESL Teacher Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: Very discussion-based. Wonderful experience overall. 99% of the staff and teachers have lived and worked around the world, so it felt like re-joining a global family of teachers. With experienced ESL instructors, there is already a heightened awareness of inter-cultural needs, so we discussed making sure we were on the same page in this respect as well reviewing my submitted mock lesson plan.
Interview Questions: How do you create a balanced learning environment among typically outspoken and more withdrawn cultures?

title: Postdoctoral Scholar Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at UC San Diego in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was very informal, it requires mostly the basic knowledge of your previous research. You should be able to convince the employer that you are one of the best fit for the position.
Interview Questions: Previous experiences in the field

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied through internal job posting system. Didn't hear back, so I followed up on my own. Got invited to the interview. I thought it didn't go well, so I followed up thanking them for this opportunity. Got immediatel hired.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your teaching experience.

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, was emailed for an interview. I had worked with some of the folks in this department beforehand and they knew I was applying. I got an offer on the spot, it was a good day.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a student that didn't want to historically analyze Christian holy texts?

title: IT Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with technical questions and role play scenario ranging from easy to medium, hard in-person technical interview with character and morale questions. all very friendly people, not very difficult if you know your way around a windows computer
Interview Questions: why do you want to work here

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: There was a Group Interview of about eight candidates, where we were asked to do a group exercise, ranking different situations, followed by an Individual Interview, we were asked about ten questions.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be an Advising Intern

title: Recreation Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was very easy. The hiring manager was very nice and easy to talk to. Very approachable. I enjoyed it and was very laid back. Not tense at all. Be prepared to talk about yourself. They do ask a lot of personality questions.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this?

title: Development Engineer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: It was a standard interview process.  Nothing special.  Standard questions pertaining to the job card.  Most jobs require at sea time or travel due to the nature of the job as stated in the job card.
Interview Questions: What is your name.

title: Senior Business Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: There are 2 rounds of interview: 1 round with a panel of 4 members and 2nd one with the Director. It takes a long time from the time you are called first till the offer is made since it has to go through HR.
Interview Questions: Difference between validation and verification

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: Didn't really have an interview of sorts. As a grad student, I had to write a statement of purpose and send it to the University. They looked through it along with my other academic documents such as GRE, TOEFL scores and my GPA and my Letters of Recommendation ofcourse!
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Tell me about yourself type question. No technical questions, a lot behavioral how would you react to...? The interview lasted about 30min wasn't. Asked about time commitment. They know that as a student you have to balance school and other activities so theyre pretty understanding of time.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Faculty Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online and was contacted to interview about a week and a half later (from the point of the application deadline) and there were two rounds of interviews. 

First round: an hour interview with dept. administrators
They asked some of the general interview questions like "tell me a little about yourself" and "what particularly interests you about this job". Then they asked scenario questions where I had to assess how to prioritize amongst fluctuating tasks. I was contacted 3 days later to move forward to the 2nd interview.

Second round: two hours - interviewed with two professors separately 
The first professor focused on my travel arrangement experience and how I would manage communication on different time zones. Professor also inquired about my financial management experience and how I kept track of short-term and long-term projects. Professor also inquired of thinking about a method of how to respond to all their emails in a 24-hour cycle. The gist of this interview was that the professor mostly discussed what they wanted to obtain out of the candidate rather than ask direct questions.
The second professor interview was the most difficult one of them all because the questions required quick answers even though some of them required thought. For instance, professor wanted to know how I preferred communication when I did something wrong - would I want to be taken aside to discuss the matter or would in front of my peers be ok. Bu then the professor asked about a time when I worked with a difficult person, how I managed, and how would I hypothetically manage in this environment (UC). I felt that the professor had a grill-down approach.

I have a positive outlook of the interviews but I have a negative outlook of the decision-making process. The position was ultimately cancelled on the basis that the professors decided last minute that they wanted a candidate who had grant writing experience and the original job post didn't have that requirement in the qualifications list. Under UCSD policy the job post needed to be reposted with the additional qualification rather than re-reviewing the job applications of the original post. I was left wondering if that was the real reason, however, because it has now been a little over three months since the conclusion of my interviews and I never saw that the department repost the position.
Interview Questions: What's your preferred method of communication when you do something incorrectly? In front of yours peers, taken aside for a chat or meeting?

title: Programmer Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions:
1 round of technical interview with questions regarding spring, java, databases,agile process
second round of interview with the director for oveview of job. i was then offered the job within a week of the interview
Interview Questions: spring, java,database, design, agile process

title: Research Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Sent in the application, got a call back about a week and a half later. Had an interview by someone in the Education department. About another week later they let me know I did not get the job.
Interview Questions: What was the most interesting research project you have been a part of?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview was scheduled to your convenience. It was a group interview with 3 interviewees and 2 or 3 interviewers. We were first asked to give an introduction. Then each of us was asked a scenario question.
Interview Questions: What is the most important quality for you to be a team player

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: Informal, nice and relaxed, didn't feel like an interview to be honest. We talked about my previous experience in research and went over my skills.Then we spoke about the actual project itself and what my responsibilities would entail. In total, the interview lasted about 30 minutes.
Interview Questions: Talk about previous experience and plans for the future.

title: Temporary Employess Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was a fairly traditional interview, but instead of being for a specific position, it was to see where you might fit in the larger scheme of things. They'll ask about your work history, your skills, and your goals. Then you'll take a 4 part qualification exam. First part is typing, second is business vocabulary, third, Excel proficiency, and finally Word proficiency. Then you'll do a live scan in office (for free!) and go back up to you interviewer to go over your results.
Interview Questions: They'll want to know what kind of experience with academic settings you have.

title: BYA Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Apply online through UCSD job website. Then they send most qualified resumes to the people who will interview you. I had the 2 education program managers interview me. They told me in advance that I would need to prepare a 5 minute lesson on tide pools to school children and that I would have props to use. It was a typical interview. They called me back after what seemed a considerable period of time (maybe 3 weeks?) and offered me a job. Many of the people that work here were volunteers at one point, or had some experience working at Scripps or as a student, so that could be a good way to get relevant experience and get known (though it won't guarantee you an interview, as you must meet the qualifications and also I was persistent, having not made it through the HR screening previously).
Interview Questions: Two strengths and two weaknesses

title: Student Lead Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the promotion via email to my managers. I had to provide my resume and cover letter. I was told I would have an interview within 2-3 days after they stopped taking applications. The interview itself was with managers I had already worked with, so it was a comfortable, non-hostile environment.
Interview Questions: If you and another Lead disagreed about what to prioritize, what would you do?

title: CSE Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: Online application, in person interview. It helps the most if you know the professor in person, or if you know current tutors. If you want to get the job as a tutor, make sure you list the professor / class as your #1 choice. This will generally get you to the interviews.
Interview Questions: Material from the final exam of the class that you will be tutoring. Be sure to study the final from the professor who you will be tutoring with. Some professors choose slightly different material.

title: CAD Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: the interview was informal, we went over my resume and job experience then glance over the job description for the position, then i was asked to draft a fairly simple part and a schematic drawing in solidworks.  I got the offer on the spot.
Interview Questions: how many years of cadding experience have you had?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Laid back, on couches, and the basic idea was to determine interest in the research the lab was conducting. Eventually, the interview became technical to understand how much foundational knowledge you have.
Interview Questions: What do you hope to accomplish with your research?

title: Orientation Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: First filled out the application form and was informed to attend a group interview within a week. The interview was separated into several sections where the group was assigned with different assignments or topics to discuss. During the entire process, there were former orientation leaders serve as observers and taking notes.
Interview Questions: Why do you think you will be a good fit as an orientation leader

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: I didn't have one. You need to reach out to a professor, it helps if you're in their course. This is a great way to get close to professor, get a mentor, get into their research lab, etc. Pay is good, for a student.
Interview Questions: Just reviewed my courses and experience.

title: Post Doc Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with PI of group.  Didn't get the opportunity to talk to rest of team during the interview process.  I thought that was a bit weird.  PI seemed like a decent guy and was really energetic, but even from the get go seemed a bit too pushy.
Interview Questions: Asked about my previous research and how did I think I would fit in his lab.

title: Acqusition Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: got email inviting to interview, relative normal interview questions, 2 interviewers and 1 of them was future supervisor.  said will contact me either way. got rejected first and then got an extended offer
Interview Questions: why would you like to work in the library?

title: House Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: Was pretty chill didn't ask any hard questions, just behavioral i guess. they were very kind and gentle. I was relaxed the whole time. during the whole time i was asked easy questions. I made sure t speak smoothly and confidently. One thing that was intimidating was that there were three people interviewing me which kinda freaked me out.
Interview Questions: Can you lift 50 pounds

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Applied online first and got an email telling me to interview. Interviewed with a panel of three and each of them just asked me a question at a time. They also went through the daily routine of what they expect the Administrative Assistant will do. Overall a pretty relaxing interview process for student workers who are looking for a part time job on campus
Interview Questions: Q: Please tell us how your overall background has prepared you for this position and give us a quick overview of your current position

title: Staff Research Associate II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA)
Interview Descriptions:
2 in person interviews with Department of Pediatrics.  First was with 2 Study managers which were both lacking any social skills. 1 had her hands on her face resting her elbows on the table like she was bored with my interview.  The other was asking all the questions in a distracting monotone voice. 

I was then called a week later in the evening to schedule a 2nd interview.  Who calls at 6pm to schedule interviews???  I came back for a 2nd interview, I checked in the front desk with a woman who was yelling at another staff over the phone regarding supply orders. I go in the same conference room with 2 other study coordinators who asked the same questions yet failed to write any information down on paper.  I left the interview completely confused on the lack of professionalism from this department. I received a call 2 mo later if I was still interested in the position.
Interview Questions: What are your strength and weaknesses?

title: Language Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: First, phone call to set interview time; Second, interview by asking questions to get to know my experience and my passion. Thrid, to set another time for presentation. To give a demo by using powerpoint presentation.
Interview Questions: what types of jobs you have done before?

title: Inventory Specialist - Temp Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: I submitted a resume to Temporary Employment Services for a general position. A month later I received a call out of the blue about a position they felt I was a good fit for. One week later I had a 15 minute phone interview during which they asked anecdotal-based questions. A week after that I came in for an in-person interview during which they asked basically the same questions, they just wanted to see if they liked me.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you had to deal with a customer who had absolutely no experience in inventory, and you had to teach them everything.

title: Development Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: I had three separate sets of interviews. One with a panel of people in a role similar to mine, one with the direct team I'd be working with, and one with the person who would be my boss. Essentially the same questions were asked in each round.
Interview Questions: What is one aspect of your job that you would just as soon have someone else handle?

title: Food Service Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: No interview process at the time, all that was necessary was to fill out an application form. The person who was responsible for the application process was a student manager, which makes it a very laid-back experience
Interview Questions: Asked when I would be ready for overview of work area/safety

title: Student Attendant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Easy and relaxed. Relatively straightforward process as I am a student here. The application process took about 2 weeks. Friendly manager. There is really not much to it just be confident and you will be fine.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself. What is your availability like. How long can you stay at the department

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: just a presentation with my PhD research in a group meeting. And talk to everyone in the lab to know what it this lab focused on. Principle investigator asked questions about working interests and work time.
Interview Questions: question with experimental design and expanded questions

title: Asset Management Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions:
Applied on school career portal, 
came in for in-person interview with asset manager in the accounting department. Met director and team and was told basic duties. Was asked a series of questions about experiences. Overall a really quick and easy interview - lasted approximately 30 minutes. Very welcoming and comfortable.
Interview Questions: Basic about skills/experiences

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Simple process. Enthusiasm, and interest is of utmost importance. I applied for a biology research assistant position. Your experience will largely depend on the research lab you join. Depending on group, some work experience is necessary. Class experience can sometimes substitute for experience, but you should do well in your classes!
Interview Questions: Why our lab?

title: Controller Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: in person interview and quizzes after several phone interviews. applied online and heard back a few weeks later regarding scheduling an in-person interview. met with about 8 different people during my in-person interview, and they quizzed me on questions related to the job.
Interview Questions: about my previous experience

title: Graduate Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: I applied to UCSD in 2011 and received an email from the professor. Following to our email I visited UCSD to see the office and labs. I had a lunch with the group members and during lunch they talk about their current research. I had a great opportunity talk about the lab facilities since I was planing to do some full scale tests. One of the group member gave me a tour at the labs.
Interview Questions: my master thesis

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: University interview followed by manager interview. Interview was fairly easy as it contained mainly management questions. Got an email from upper management stating that I have been accepted and I have 2 days to accept or reject the offer
Interview Questions: How do you handle multiple projects?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Brief, the interviewer acted as if the pool was large enough so that they could cherry pick between candidates, which is very true for undergraduate research labs. Didn't feel like there was a lot of respect.
Interview Questions: What is your experience regarding running experiments?

title: Event Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Diego in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: Phone Interview that lasted about 1 hour in length. It was a phone interview with about five people on the call that alternated between asking me questions. After the interview about a week later I was asked to come in for a face to face interview. The in-person interview was less of an interview and more of a further explanation of what the job entailed.
Interview Questions: Why do you like to do good?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: My interview was great. But it's obviously going to be very lab-dependent.  It was very laid back. I presented my work from my PhD, we talked ideas, got to know each other, discussed potential future projects.
Interview Questions: What are your interests?

title: Sales Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Super chill. Basically went right into talking about scheduling and availability. Asked a few questions about hobbies, school life, time management. Then asked how you would respond to three different scenarios relating to customer service.
Interview Questions: How would you assist a customer looking for a pen?

title: Postdoctoral Researcher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: The dog went to the park and caught the ball. What cor was the dog if his coat was white during the day? Note that the dog only ate purina dog food. The aforementioned scenario is the type of question you can expect to be asked. Got it? Grest, dude.
Interview Questions: Do you like school?

title: Anonymous Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Applied online for the position. Was emailed in roughly two weeks saying that they were interested in my application. One interview with department head who wanted to know more about my passion for the department rather than asking generic questions.
Interview Questions: Why are you the best candidate?

title: IT Desktop Support Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Fairly straight forward.  Not much stress or in depth questions, they just want to see what kind of skills you have, how well you manage your time, what you want to get out of the position, etc.
Interview Questions: How do you manage your time?

title: Content Development Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was contacted two months later by the marketing department's hiring manager to set up an in-person interview. The first interview consisted of a panel of six different people from the department. It was a little overwhelming, but they were all very nice and professional. Before the interview, I was asked to complete a writing assignment and also submit samples of my past professional writing work. I was invited back for a second interview with the panel, which was much easier than the first. This interview mostly consisted of simple questions about rating my skills in various tasks and answering questions about how I deal with different issues that may arise while working on a project.
Interview Questions: What three to five words would you use to describe your work style?

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Need to bypass robots- application will then get forwarded to dept.  Once with department, you will interview with a full panel. Interview is about 1.5 hours long. Referrals needed.
Interview Questions: Experience and behavior based

title: Able Bodied Seaman Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was very easy. They needed an AB, and I was there handing in my resume. There was conversation of being hired on with other research vessels, but as I said before this is a temporary position for the time being short while the vessel finds a new owner.
Interview Questions: When can you start?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Read about position on a group page on Facebook within UCSD. Applied online via PortTriton. Received email from supervisor asking to set up an interview. Had to go through HR screening process and background check. Came in to interview with supervisor one day and then met office manager another time. Was notified via email of offer for part-time student work.
Interview Questions: How to address moment of customer dissatisfaction

title: Student Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: One on one in person interview with an HR representative. I was asked general questions about why I wanted to work there and what I hoped to get out of the experience. Also general questions about my resume, nothing too philosophical or especially challenging. My skills were not tested or anything like that. I was only asked questions about fit.
Interview Questions: Why UCSD?

title: Food Service Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applied for a food service worker position for UCSD Health. Interview was pretty straight forward; I sat down with some RD's who asked me questions about my background and working in health care. They also asked me my knowledge of special diets for patients and my background in leadership. I did not get the job however, possibly due to being overqualified.
Interview Questions: Are you familiar with patient diets?

title: Graduate Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was in need to find a lab to work as a graduate student researcher, so I had contacted some faculty mementos in my area.  The interview was in-person interview after the resume was emailed to the faculty
Interview Questions: My research experience and the background

title: Laboratory Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: Standard questions: strengths and weaknesses as well as job specific questions such as what is your experience with coding. what did you like about your previous relevant experience. Also asked why you wanted to work here, what are your future plans. Also explained study. Pretty standard as far as interviews go. Nothing too out of the ordinary. Assuming they went with a candidate with more experience. Sent follow up email and they asked for more references. Took a long time to find out if I was offered the position.
Interview Questions: What is your biggest challenge

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview wasn't very difficult but required good knowledge. Interviewer was very friendly and easy to be around but preparation is key. Furthermore, the professor was looking for those students who were willing to put in time and effort as opposed to taking the job as a burden.
Interview Questions:
How I can contribute as TA?
Why did you pick the Math department?
How to solve a certain integral with Green's Theorem

title: House Manager Interview

Interview Descriptions: Interview was very casual and they asked much about my life as a student and aspirations after college. Appropriate because this is an on-campus job. They had me sit down and it was more of a conversation then anything. One thing they wanted to make sure was what I knew about the job and what I was getting myself into. The manager even emphasized that he wanted my grades to maintain while taking on the job.
Interview Questions: What do you want to do after graduating college?

title: Trio Outreach Calculus Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview took place about a month after the application was sent in and was about 30 minutes long. The setting was relaxed and there were two interviewers who alternated asking questions. I found out that I got the position within the following two weeks.
Interview Questions: If a kid needs to see a nurse, a supervisor asks you to do a task, or the administration office calls you in for a question which do you do first.

title: Assistant Project Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Poor, the people were afraid for their jobs, the pay was low and the interviewer was a complete jerk. I enjoy science, but when a person who sought to recruit me insults me to my face, I tune out.
Interview Questions: Insulting

title: Recreation Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Called me after submitting my application and scheduled an in-person interview at UCSD campus in the Recreation Center area. The supervisors all joined, sat around me in a meeting room and asked me questions about my experience related to working with people and children, with outdoor activity and child program implementing, as well as my experience and approach to inspiring, encouraging, teaching, counseling and guiding groups of children.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you had to overcome an obstacle.

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: A brief interview was conducted by a group of workers/supervisors/managers under the computer science and engineering department (fiscal branch). The process include a series of basic interview questions and a short quiz. The first part of the quiz was on calculating tax percentages (calculator provided.) Then, the applicant is given a list of names (some of which had typos), and the misspelled names had to be circled out. This part tested the applicant's attention to details and whether or not they were able to catch the mistakes.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Assistant Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Pretty lengthy. Started with a call to screen. Then a lengthy phone interview. Then in person interview. Overall from applying online to job offer, the process took about 2 months.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: ECE Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: I came in the tutoring center and meet one of the guy. The interview lasted about 30 minutes in a separate tutoring room. Two current tutors asked about 5 or 6 technical questions about classes I took and I put on the application, and a few behavioral questions. Generally it is not hard and only about the basics ideas of each class.
Interview Questions: Convolution, diode circuit, op-amp, equivalent circuits

title: AcademicProgram UCDC Peer Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed about 30 minutes with the UCDC Coordinator and AIP Director. They were friendly and asked basic questions. There is nothing to worry about. Just be prepared and be confident then you will be fine!
Interview Questions:
What was your greatest challenge?
How did you get involve in college life?
What experience you think could be helpful for the position?

title: TES/Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: Applied online // Contacted several weeks later after my references were checked // Set up interview // One on one interview, followed by computer skills testing (I suggest reviewing before you interview) and FBI fingerprints // Attend orientation ---> Get placed and begin work
Interview Questions: How comfortable are you using Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint? Also data entry and clerical tasks.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Submit application through student job portal, got an email back from the employee, went in and interviewed with the employee, got another email to go interview with the manager of the sector.
Interview Questions: What experiences do you have with excel?

title: Administrative Assistant (Student) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: Had a brief yet thorough interview with the manager. Asked a lot of behavioral questions and it will ultimately a great experience. I felt that there were many questions that were asked that dealt with scenarios being that I applied for a position as an admin assistant. You learn lots from the position but it may or may not be useful in the end.
Interview Questions: How well do you do with deadlines?

title: Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: The interview wasn't scheduled well, and I had to come there twice. At the second time, they told me this position supposed to work seven days per week. I didn't take it.
Interview Questions: What you did most at your last job?

title: Quality Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: There was an hour-long phone interview. The follow-up was a panel interview with the manager and another analyst. I then went directly in for a one on one meeting with the the director of the department. The questions were largely informal except for the technical questions.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for UCSD?

title: Conference Services Hospitality Clerk Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego (New York, NY) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: There's a group interview that's pretty basic. We were asked to complete a group project of creating an advertisement on a poster board in five minutes. Make sure you demonstrate leadership and teamwork and attention to detail. The questions were simple, like about good customer service and past work experience.
Interview Questions: Give us an example of great customer service.

title: Sales Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: Very easy interview, pretty much anybody can do it. If you get an interview expect to be accepted to the position that very day. I feel like they just pick student workers based on their schedule rather than their skills. You will have to be a very incompetent interviewer to not get an offer if you are extended an interview in my opinion.
Interview Questions: Why did you apply to this position?

title: Job At International Center Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: So one of the advisors in International center emailed me and had me in for little more than half an hour. It was a nice time, the interviewer was nice, and it was an easy interview as well, since they are not expecting too much from a student. The questions are simple, mostly related to activities and personalities.
Interview Questions: Q: What are some of your past experience as a leader?

title: Labor Relations Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions:
I received an email from an administrative assistant requesting a phone interview. The phone interview was with two department managers about a week later. They were very nice and the questions were average and routine. Explain your past employment, experiences and education etc... Here is where UCSD gets a big fail! No communication, if you look at your status on their online system, it will go from "Application Received" to "Position Filled." 

This is barely tolerable if you take the time to apply and you cannot even get a basic rejection email, but it is completely classless to make a person interview and you never hear from anyone again. I sent emails after a month of waiting and they did not have the common courtesy to even reply. I am shocked there are not more complaints reference this behavior on Glassdoor.

I have friends and relatives who have encountered similar behavior and worse. If you call or write any of the HR recruiters, they give you the standard brush off. If you have a follow-up question, they immediately become snarky and rude. They are completely aware of their power position in this case and use it to their advantage. Shame on them!

This is a government institution, paid for by government funds, there are protocols in place for the entire hiring process and it is all ignored. If you go onto their Blink System, there is a hiring manual for department managers and screen shots of their hiring system computer pages. It is all ignored and nobody is watching over the process. Office of Ethics & Compliance.....HELLO? Someone needs to give these hiring entities a swift kick and bring them in line with a certain level of professionalism and business acumen.

How about an anonymous employment applicant questionnaire?
Interview Questions: Explain your involvement with labor relations at your present job?

title: Sales Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: You go to the bookstore to ask for an application, they are always hiring usually. You turn it in and if they see you fit they call you to schedule an interview. The interview is by 2 or 3 managers, they ask you typical questions and they will let you know if they want you a few days after, they will call you.
Interview Questions: What would you tell a customer that refuses to pay $300 for a textbook?

title: Student Lead Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: Sat down in a conference room with a panel of interviewers.  They asked me situational questions.  For example, they asked me how I would handle an impatient customer.  They also asked me to direct a fictional person around campus using a map and a pen.
Interview Questions: Please direct me from here (The Village) to the Student Services Building using this map and this pen.

title: Graduate Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Notified of acceptance by letter, and invited to attend a preview weekend to interview with faculty to see which labs would be a good fit for me. NOTE: THIS PROCESS HAS CHANGED AND NOW YOU HAVE TO INTERVIEW BEFORE ACCEPTANCE.
Interview Questions: In my case, professors mainly asked about my undergraduate career and background. Then they waited for me to ask my questions about their lab and research.

title: Center for Student Involvement - Communication and Leadership - Peer Educator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: You had to apply online. After all resume's were reviewed, I was selected for an interview. The Interview consisted with a panel of 4 and also 5 interviewees. It was overall a pretty average interview with typical questions about why are you interested and also how involved you are in school. In addition, it was hard to outshine your peers because they asked each individuals different questions.
Interview Questions: The most difficult question was when they told us to get together with the other interviewees to come together and come up with a plan to market an event.

title: Physician Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by the former member of in my position. I did not meet the DR until later in the day. When I did meet we were at lunch and was casual.
Interview Questions: What were your former responsibilities at your former job?

title: Circulation Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was emailed after submitting an application, then was interviewed on site. The experience was nice. The interviewers became my managers, and they were very respectful. They asked questions and gave time for me to elaborate my answers.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a rude customer?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed for a internship under UCSD's Logistics Department. I applied by contacting UCSD's human resource department and asking if they had any open positions related to finance, management. They forwarded my resume to the department and I was contacted a few days later. The interview itself was fair and not too bad at all, I received a phone call a few days later with a job offer.
Interview Questions: If you are assigned two tasks, both of equal importance and you only have time to do one, what would you do?

title: Workshop Event Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with 2 people worked in the same department, one is the head of the event, another is the head of the department. It was very chill and got offer 30 min later.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you work on a team, have you meet any difficulties, and how did you overcome that?

title: Graduate Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: I first submitted my resume to the professor. I then had a technical round where he asked me questions about my coursework and projects. I was then offered an opportunity to do a project for a quarter(10 weeks). I did well in it and asked the professor for a a GSR offer.
Interview Questions: explaining the projects mentioned on my resume.

title: Graduate Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at UC San Diego in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: Set up meeting with professor to discuss project. Previously emailed professor CV but was asked to elaborate on experience in laboratories and research environments. Introduced to other students in lab and was given a tour of lab equipment. Offered position on the spot.
Interview Questions: What are you trying to do after graduation

title: Water Safety Instructor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions:
Submitted my application through Port Triton and followed up with the head of the department who scheduled an interview within a week.

They are looking for people who have experience teaching swim lessons, preferably with Red Cross/CPR certifications already, and are willing to renew your expired certification if necessary.

Interview was very laid back. Mostly asked about my experiences as a swimmer and teaching swimming. It seemed like they mainly want someone who can communicate well with others.
Interview Questions: describe a situation where you had a parent complaining about your lesson, and how you would resolve the issue.

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: it went very very fast.  i was already a grad student here in the same lab.  just had to sign a piece of paper and then i was a postdoc
Interview Questions: when can you start

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online at the HDH (Housing Dining Hospitality) website. Pretty much everyone gets an interview since there are so many positions open at the start of the school year/during the end of Summer. 

You're in a room with about 10 other people, and the interviewers just go down the line ask basic questions (previous work history, etc.). It takes about 20 minutes altogether. Low stress. It's impossible to mess up. Everyone gets the same question, so most people just say, "Yeah. What he/she said."

Then, you get contacted a couple of days later (or towards the beginning of the school year) and you have to come back in for orientation. You have to sign a bunch of tax information/fill out a pre-made work packet. Then you have to complete an hour long set of videos and questions. It's a drag. I heard people who apply during the school year don't actually have to do this, but I'm not sure if that's true or not. Finally, they ask you where you want to work. I HIGHLY recommend you work in a market. It's a lot easier than working in a dinning hall, and you get the same perks/pay.
Interview Questions: Something along the lines of: "If there is a spill in the store that needs to be cleaned up, your manager just asked you to stock the floor, and there is a customer waiting at the registering, in what order would you handle those situations?"

title: Student Lead Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: Went through a group interview. It was very easy they asked questions to whole group and asked customer service questions as well as questions on how you would deal with certain situations.
Interview Questions: Asked questions about how you would deal with customers and previous experience.

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: The interview consisted of straightforward questions that assessed the interviewee's response to hypothetical work situations/problems and a quick explanation of previous work experience. While, the overall hiring process took a little than a week as there was an orientation going over the pay cycle and policies, in addition to paper work to sign. The overall process was not difficult at all.
Interview Questions: No, difficult or unexpected questions

title: Residential Dining Food Service Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: The first step is to apply online. Then, when there are spots that need to be filled, they contact potential employees via e-mail. There is one group interview in which the heads of all the dining services facilities meet with three interviewers. Within a week, they make the hiring decision.
Interview Questions: Describe when you have experienced bad customer service and explain what should have been done instead.

title: Marketing Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: Easy if you are a good fit. Make sure the key words on your resume matches the key works on the job posting. The lab I worked for was very friendly and accepting. I applied out of state.
Interview Questions: Standard questions

title: Facility Access Member Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: It is very difficult to get an interview for this position as there are countless students applying. However, I applied at what was just the right time and was called back for an interview. The Intverview was about an hour long and was very informal. It was more the manager getting to know me and my schedule.
Interview Questions: What previous experience have you had with making sales?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: It was fairly easy. The person emailed me late in the evening, and was very helpful. Interview went on for 30 min, and it was mostly basic casual talk. The interviewer told me about some questions but didnt ask me
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Peer Mentor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: I had to submit a cover letter, resume, and writing sample beforehand. The interview process was relatively simple: single interview, maybe 25-35 mins in length, and I was asked various questions about my previous experience with mentoring/tutoring other student writers.
Interview Questions: Asked to read through a small writing sample and run through how I would comment on that sample to a student who came to me asking for help.

title: Camp Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: There was no interview process because I was already on the swim team. Usually the coaches hire swimmers that are currently on the team because it coincides with practice. Sorry I couldn't be more help.
Interview Questions: They did not ask me any questions

title: Food Service Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: applied online, waited for couple weeks, and got a phone call, It was a group interview, about 4-5 people in a group. 3 interviewers. Questions are not hard, you dont even need experience, but preferred. A week later, I got a call telling me I'm accepted.
Interview Questions: a scenario

title: Student Assistant IV Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: Respond to posting online. Contacted by one of the lab's staff member. Took a quick tour of the lab and were asked some fairly straight forward questions about interests in the lab and personal interests.
Interview Questions: What interests you about this lab?

title: Graduate Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: There wasn't an interview process. Their hiring decision was based on the online application. Typically you go online and follow through their application process, fill out the required information and submit an application fee. Afterwards, the hiring committee send their decision based on your statement of purpose and prior experience.
Interview Questions: The statement of purpose was the hardest part of the application.

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: Applied through the main UCSD system and ranked all the colleges by preference. I got a call for my first choice and interviewed with the 2 directors. It was pretty casual and easy. Asked about what I would go in various situations and handle difficult cases.
Interview Questions: What is your teaching philosophy?

title: UCSD Shuttle Driver Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: So long as you fulfill the requirements to be a shuttle driver, you should be accepted to go into the training program. You have to pass the training and receive your commercial driver's license in order to work. The process was relatively easy.
Interview Questions: Are you able to work at least 12 hours/week

title: Aquarium Gift Shop Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: Had a nice interview outside with typical questions.  I ended up not getting an offer because my student schedule was too restrictive.  It was nice to be able to go inside and look at the aquariums and fish while waiting for my interview to begin.
Interview Questions: How important is customer service to you?

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was a graduated doctoral student filling a hole in their summer program. It was not necessary to interview as my department knew well my work. I proposed a course on Frederick Nietzsche and European artistic movements of the 20th century and it was accepted.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA)
Interview Descriptions: I contacted professors saying I was interested in applying for a fellowship to work in their lab. I came out for an on-site interview and then worked on the proposal back at my home institution. I asked whether they would support me even if I did not get the fellowship and I was promised 1-2 years of support, so I took the offer, and ended up getting a fellowship that provided three years of funding.
Interview Questions: are you interested in solving crystal structures?

title: Conference Services Summer Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Applied online and got called in for a group interview with around 4-5 other people. 

Interview process was very easy. Each applicant was asked some standard questions about past history with customer service and how you would address a difficult customer situation. As long as you had a friendly demeanor and a professed willingness to be nice to clients, I believe they accepted almost every applicant. 

The last portion of the interview was a "group test" in which we had to effectively design an advertising sign. Seemed more like an exercise to see if you could work effectively within the group, and see what roles you took in competitive situations. After hiring, they split applicants into different groups so that all leadership roles were effectively filled.
Interview Questions: What was the most difficult customer service situation you have ever had to deal with? How did you deal with it?

title: Food Service Worker Lead Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Several interviews.  3 separate occasions interviewed by 3 people each time.  Regular questions about food safety and other dining and hospitality issues.  They also asked questions about my experience and asked questions if I was comfortable driving certain types of vehicles and types of normal other Chen equipment.
Interview Questions: What is the temperature danger zone?

title: ER Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: I had one interview. Very nice interviewers who were down to earth. Those two people no longer are involved in the hiring process, as they have moved positions. They asked basic questions, nothing too complicated. They value the ability to multitask well and to be on your feet all day.
Interview Questions: All questions were fairly basic. I asked them what skills that they value/look for and that seemed to impress them and allowed me to say "I have that!"

title: Design Studio Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: Casual and friendly. Supervisor is friendly and approachable. The hours are reasonable and they are willing to work with your schedule. Most of the interview is conducted in supervisors office, but they are willing to show you around the surrounding offices, labs, and introduce you to other employees.
Interview Questions: My past experience, and how it would be applicable in this job position

title: Residential Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: Asked personal questions, and sees how prepared you are to manage up to 65 residents. Make sure to be very in tune with Equity, Diversity, and inclusion, for those questions are the ones that strike the ResDeans attention.
Interview Questions: What is your past experience with working with a diverse community

title: UCSD IR/PS Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA)
Interview Descriptions: no interview, respond to an ad online, process some emails. They're desperate
Interview Questions: none

title: Resident Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: One group interview. It was an interview with over 50 people broken down to 10 people then to five. If you did well you passed on to individual interview. On group interview you had to be really outgoing in order to stand out among all the people. I had to ask other people to see what type of questions and activities where going to be done in the interview. Best advice would be to just be yourself!
Interview Questions: If a bike represented a team what part of the bike would you be?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: Pretty typical graduate school interview. First night (Thurs) we went out for a casual dinner with our grad student hosts, the next day (Friday)we went to interviews with faculty, then we got to go to a nice dinner and out to a local brewery. Saturday they took us out for a fun activity to see more of San Diego and then to a house party at a current students house. The grad students are friendly. The faculty mainly talked about their own research during the interviews.
Interview Questions: Do you like puzzles and do you like to cook?

title: Senior Development Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was based on transcription and the gpa you may have. And then based on the English level an Gre and the courses you have taken. Then my math should be good
Interview Questions: Why do you like ucsd

title: Residential Dining Food Service Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: Group interview where they would ask us questions and we would answer one by one. They would do lots of scenarios, which was nice to be in a group setting for so you had some time to think. Pretty laid-back interview. The interviewers were pretty friendly as well and made you feel comfortable to be there. I think they are pretty open to hiring students so it was a pretty easy process and not too nerve-wracking.
Interview Questions: Scenario of how you would handle situations at work

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: I had multiple interviews with different panels of on average 4-6 people.  They gave us some personality and IQ testing. The questions were very routine questions like reading from a book in the beginning and then switched to more analytical questions.  A little nerve racking because you cannot read anyone.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time when you resolved an issue with a coworker

title: CSO Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: They took me into a room with a sheet of paper that had a list of questions. They asked me what I was involved in. Then they moved into behavioral questions. They seemed disinterested in the things I said and just wrote down everything I said. Every time I said something they just dipped their head down and wrote. It was like I was being recorded on every little mistake I said.
Interview Questions: Tell me your strengths and weaknesses.

title: Lab Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: Found posting on third party career forum, applied through UCSD job site, received email setting up time and date, interviewed over skype for an hour, several follow-up phone calls (one of which notified me I got the job)
Interview Questions: What was a difficult situation you faced and how did you overcome it?

title: Statistician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: I was invited for the interview through email by the hiring professor. The interview took place in a meeting room. I was interviewed by the hiring professor and a statistics professor. The interview was pleasant and lasted about an hour. Follow-up was done through email and I was informed of the result in 2 months.
Interview Questions: I was asked to describe my previous work experience and the technical knowledge related with the research for my degree

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: It took 3 months from sending my resume to getting my first email from them. The interview was a panel of 6-7 ladies in 30 minutes. It was very fast paced and next thing I knew it was over. The ladies were kind and they asked normal HR questions with some basic on the job kind of questions. Overall it was a great experience, but I was not ready to be interviewed by multiple people at once.
Interview Questions: Tell me what you know about statistical programs?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: They are slow to respond, it takes 2 months from the moment you send your application to the moment they invite you for the interview.  Interview is nicely organized, people are pleasant and kind. There were no uncomfortable questions, just general about your experience. After in person interview they quickly move on if you are the right candidate.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your past experiences

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: Much of the interview process revolves around your past work. If you have a strong academic record, the interview pretty much falls into place. The PI will likely ask questions about why you want to work at the lab, what skills you could bring to the lab (this may be quite specific), and others.
Interview Questions: None, really.

title: Market Food Service Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in Oct 2013
Interview Descriptions: One group interview with 4-5 other candidates in front of a panel of 3-4 interviewers (managers and associate managers who currently work in the dining halls or markets). Round robin answering. You get to hear others' responses before you answer depending on who answers the question first. They choose who gets to answer first for each question.
Interview Questions: Have you had any prior experience working in food services? What responsibilities do you think you would need to perform at a dining hall or food market?

title: Chemical Safety (Spec II) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and received an email from HR. Then a phone call. Over all the process was pretty quick. We scheduled the interview for the following week. The interview was pretty straight forward however I found out later that an internal candidate was already picked for the position and they were only interviewing out of protocol.
Interview Questions: Mostly regulation based questions. The kind of information you would need to know if you were doing a lab inspection. They did ask a weird question about handing complaints (accusations of interfering with their research time) from a lab when you were only doing your job. They must have some cranky labs there.

title: Graduate Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA)
Interview Descriptions:
It is more like academic application.
I first contacted the future supervisor/professor by email, stating my interest and background, and providing my publications, academic GPA, etc.
Then I had phone interview with the professor for a very short time, like 10 minutes. I did not visit because I was in another country.
Then I was offered the work-study position, which will be renewed every year upon supervisor's approval. And I accepted it.
Interview Questions: Why you want to come to UCSD?

title: Cashier Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: they ask you to come in for an interview if you are interested and then they ask if you can work a minimum of 12 hours per week, if you have attention to detail, and the last thing they ask is a challenge you have had in the work force,  the interview is really quite a joke.
Interview Questions: they asked what a signigigant challenge you have had at another job was

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions:
Sent in a resume and cover letter and was contacted a week later for a face to face interview. The interview lasted around 20-25 minutes with the direct supervisor and another person involved with the program. 

Followed up and didn't hear about for about 3 weeks. Turns out the supervisor took a trip to Europe and forgot to contact me.
Interview Questions: Can you tell me the history and evolution of the Public Service Minor? Where would you add improvements?

title: Stem Cell Biologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: Faculty assistant sent an email on 08/23/2013 (Friday) and scheduled a telephone interview. Interview held on Monday, 08/26/2013. Interviewer (Faculty who was hiring) called on time, stated that he/she is out of town (and therefore suggesting that he/she was calling from a location other than san diego. A search done after the interview showed that this telephone number belonged to one Brenda Johns of WA!!!). At the end of the interview, approximately 1 minute time was given for asking questions to interviewer. Interviewer mentioned that I will be contacted in 2 weeks time to inform whether or not I am selected for an on site interview. Duration of the telephone interview was 30 min.
Interview Questions: Along the line of "have you repaired any instruments".

title: Mailroom Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: Sent my resume online and got a reply back within two weeks to set up an interview time with the supervisor. When I met with her she was extremely friendly and welcoming. We talked and a bit and she asked me to tell her a little about myself. The interview went really well.
Interview Questions: Say a student came to our office asking how to get to his first class, on this map let him know what direction to go and find him a route to follow.

title: Temporary Employment Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UC San Diego in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: After submitting my resume for multiple TES listings, I was contacted to set up an interview.  This consisted of a fairly typical ~30min interview (focusing on administrative skills in my case) followed by a software skills test which took about an hour.  It tests for proficiency in Word, Excel, and includes a typing test. At this point they run a back ground check (including a live scan).  I came in about a week later for a group orientation, and then it was a waiting game for them to get a position that lined up with my skill set.  So far I have only been placed once, and it took about 2 weeks for them to have something for me.
Interview Questions: The most difficult part of the interview for me had to be the Excel proficiency test.  I had always thought of myself as fairly well versed in Excel, and had taken a course on it several years ago and used semi-frequently in previous jobs.  I did not expect it to be so in-depth, and they are looking for you to know shortcuts, as they are judging how quickly you can manuever the program as well.

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview twice. It was a pleasant interview and everything went smoothly. I had a phone interview twice. It was a pleasant interview and everything went smoothly.
Interview Questions: why are you interested in this position?

title: Lab Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: Applied online on the UCSD website.  Checked the website about a week or so later and was "referred to hiring department." Got an email directly from the P.I. to set up an interview. Spoke over Skype for about an hour for the interview with the P.I. Very typical interview questions. Whole process probably took about 3 weeks.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: Got contacted via email about an interview opportunity and had one via skype since I was out of the country. Typical interview questions about how you would handle situations in an office and previous work experience.
Interview Questions: What would you do if you came into the office when it wasn't your shift but saw that your co-worker was struggling to deal with a long line?

title: Operations Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: Phone Interview. Resume Submission. The Standard protocol.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you multi-tasked

title: ESL Instructor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: I had to submit my transcripts along with a lesson plan and fill out the on line application.  The interview was informal and mostly just small talk.
Interview Questions: What would make you a better teacher?

title: Student Involvement Leadership Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: - Group interview, make sure you get your points in on how and why you would be a great asset to the team
Interview Questions: - There will be a mock group effort project that changes for every interview. Have quick wits and use teamwork to succeed.

title: Cashier Interview
