Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: normally student filled position with high turnover rate.  boring and not too stressful, except for not being able to sit or relax very much during downtime.  not much activity during the summer, but good pocket money.
Interview Questions: had to take test to see if read handbook

title: Assistant Project Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UC San Diego in May 2013
Interview Descriptions:
email with P.I in charge, then had a phone interview and went to visit the lab. stay for a full day in the lab and spoke with all lab members then we went for dinner at night

got the offer the day after my interview
Interview Questions: why do you want to work in academia

title: UCSD Shuttle Driver Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: Basically No interview process. I remember walking with hiring manager down the office hall way and he basically just asked "Do you want to work here? Here, pick a training session that isn't full". Super simple. They are always looking for new drivers because of the high turnover rate of graduating students. Training takes about a month before you a fully trained driver.
Interview Questions: Do you want to work here?

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: Going through essential tasks and checking for competency. Asked basic questions about knowledge of job requirements and background for position. Easy and informal interview that lasted maybe an hour. Easy.
Interview Questions: Fastest way to pipette 1500 uL of solution with 1000 uL pipetter.

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions:
-telephone interview
-question on experience, background, urgent care, passion for counseling center work
-will ask about your fit with rotations
-6 postdocs are accepted
-will call to offer position
Interview Questions: Ask about your fit with the different rotations offered

title: Advisor Interview
Application Type: The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Answer hypotheticals, meet with Dean. Prepare for scenario type questions. The interview is typically with a panel of your potential colleagues and your supervisor. They will want you to have experience, be a team player and be ready to jump in with positive enthusiasm.
Interview Questions: Describe a conflict and how you addressed it.

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Diego in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Very easy and to the point. One phone call and then skype. Hiring process was done in few days and got the offer that I accepte. The process was quick.
Interview Questions: All related to previous research.

title: Project Management Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions:
Sent an email inquiring about the position to a Project Manager.

Relaxed interview with Assistant Director of Project Management and another Project Manager.

Came in to the office at a convenient time and answered personality and behavioral questions.
Interview Questions:
How well do you work in teams?
How good are you with deadlines?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: email with P.I in charge, then had a phone interview and went to visit the lab. stay for a full day in the lab and spoke with all lab members then we went for dinner at night got the offer the day after my interview
Interview Questions: how is your life

title: Student Assistant IV Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions:
- emailed resume to (future) boss
- boss arranges meeting for interview
- asked about programming experience during interview
- asked if I would be capable of designing a software system while I'm here <-- very much appreciated, he went straight to the point instead of jumping around loopholes of how good am I with programming, etc.
Interview Questions: no difficult question

title: Technical Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was easy, but long and drawn out.
Interview Questions: What do you think makes a good manager?

title: Administrative Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: One interview with Supervisor, HR Manager, and potential colleague.  Relaxed atmosphere and welcoming environment.  Asked questions based on personality, knowledge of job, history in field. Took tour of the office after the interview.
Interview Questions: What are the steps to closing out a grant?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC San Diego (Mountain Home, ID) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: There was really no interview process. I applied by mail and got accepted as is. I am really just writing some words here to fill the fifty word minimum, so that I can finally look up salaries at other places. Why would Glassdoor not let me skip this if I do not have to say anything? This is a weird world
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Postdoctoral Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UC San Diego in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions:
I found a job advertisement at nature jobs. Following submission of a cover letter and a resume I had a skype interview of about half an hour.
The decision to offer me the job was made quick. As it included an international relocation and visa process the formal part from the side of the officials of UC San Diego and the American immigration offices took a couple of months. The staff at the department that hired me was helpful and responsive to e-mails.
Interview Questions:
Research experience: what I worked on and the institution (including affiliated institutions) I was working at the time of the interview.
What I would like to work on.
How I saw my role in a team.

title: Setup and Field Lining Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is relatively straight forward. I would say it was not too difficult and kept a laid back attitude. It is important to reference skills of working on multiple projects simultaneously. The actual hiring process can take a while for all of the paperwork to go through so be patient. The training with the initial hiring can be tiresome.
Interview Questions: What is your favorite animal and why

title: Resident Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UC San Diego in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Submit online application which involves answering a few essay questions. If application is accepted there is a group interview among 60 other students. If you make it through the group interview process then there is an individual interview with all of the assistant deans, the dean and the head of housing and dinning services.
Interview Questions: How would you confront an underaged friend heavily intoxicated in the resident halls?

title: Postdoctoral Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions:
I submitted a regular job application. eg. cover letter and resume with references. Next I
had an interview over skype and that was it.
The hiring process took very long, partly because it included paper work for an international researcher to get a visa. Still this process should go much faster.
Interview Questions:
research experience
work attitude
vision on collaboration
career ambition

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Like every other postdoc position, its entirely up to the individual PI and theres no involvement from the university. So what is there to say? Give a talk, see if you mesh with the lab, figure out projects and money. UCSD admin weren't really involved.
Interview Questions: When you (insert obscure technique) to examine (obscure cellular process), did (irrelevent protein) appear to have a role?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: It was a good and positive experience. Gave a presentation, had a small interview, followed by lunch..... got to interact with my potential colleagues as well. Very competitive environment but I also got to learn a lot.
Interview Questions: Why there was a gap on my resume?

title: Administrative Assistant (Student) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Applied through school site with not much work experience, got an email asking for availability and financial aid award letter. Asked a few behavioral questions like "tell me about yourself," What were your duties/responsibilities in your previous job? What did you learn from it?" They are very flexible to your schedule since you are a student.
Interview Questions: " What were your duties/responsibilities in your previous job? What did you learn from it?"

title: Data Entry Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC San Diego (Hillcrest, San Diego, CA) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Brought around the office; talked about the work and office culture; showed us the software used for data entry; it was very relaxed and chill. she offered me the job after the tour of the two floors of the place. basically for a student office worker, if you show up and do what is asked of you, you are already better than 80% of all the student workers
Interview Questions: Do you have any questions for me?

title: College Ambassador Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in Nov 2012
Interview Descriptions: After submitting a paper application into the campus tours offices, you get emailed back by the campus tours coordinator if you were selected for a group interview. After going through their group interview process, you are given a phone call at the end of the fall quarter if you are selected for hire.
Interview Questions: Describe the university's six college system.

title: Undergraduate Research Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA)
Interview Descriptions: Turn in a resume and go in for a 1-1 interview with your PI and/or lab coordinator.
Interview Questions: It is possible that they ask you technical questions in regards to the research being done in the lab and if you have any experience in that field. Easiest way to get past these types of questions would be to read up on the research papers from the lab and do some research on your own about the techniques utilized before the interview.

title: Copywriter/Editor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and was called by one of the staff members. She asked me about my resume and qualifications and set up an on site interview. I arrived early and was interviewed by four women, all much older than me, panel style.
Interview Questions: Explain your experience with social media.

title: Dining Hall Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: Interview process involved a phone call from housing and dining followed up with a group interview at the housing and dining office. Was a panel of 3 people interviewing about 9 other candidates. At the end, we split off with individual dining hall managers. Proceeded to next level are talked one on one with the dining hall manager who I would be placed with.
Interview Questions: What makes you work well in a team?

title: HDH Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: group interview with 4 other students, were brought up to the top floor of the HDH building in Revelle. We were asked various questions in order, some students dressed in business attire and some were completely casual. You had a choice between working in the dining halls or the marketplaces.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you?

title: IT Service Desk Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in Jul 2012
Interview Descriptions: I was emailed and asked to meet for an interview, met with the hirer,
Interview Questions: Do you prefer slow or fast-paced jobs?

title: Graduate Admissions Evaluator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: I was hired as a temporary employee, then interviewed for permanent employment when the job was opened to the entire candidate pool after six months. I interviewed with my prospective supervisor and the admissions team. They took turns asking me questions about my work experience and focused on time management, organizational skills, and ability to perform under pressure.
Interview Questions: Q: Provide an example of an ethical dilemma and how you found a solution.

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Jun 2012
Interview Descriptions: A supervisor called me in for an in person interview.. It was very informal, just casual conversation about past experiences. We covered what the basic job tasks are and how the working hours will be adjusted for my class schedule. The supervisor interviewing me made sure to emphasize I was expected to work at least one day out of finals week.
Interview Questions:
Do i work well with others?
Am I reliable?

title: Assistant Project Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: Phone, skype, in house with department. The job would depend if it is on soft money or department money. If NIH funded then it is easy otherwise it is difficult
Interview Questions: Where do you see your self in 5 years

title: Swim Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: Easy and simple questions.
Interview Questions:
Hardest challenge I have had.
How to handle parents vs kids that I teach

title: Staff Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: i first spoke with supervisor on phone then i met with all staff and gave a presentation about my work experience and the. met with the future supervisor and discuss the job in more detail. it was only for one day.
Interview Questions: why you want to work here

title: Fiscal Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: one interview with three executives
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: Couple of meeting with a professor to talk about my interests, also did TA for a quarter before receiving the provisional offer. After three month, I received full-time GSR offer.
Interview Questions:
What courses did you take before?
What other projects have you worked on?
Are you are US citizen? (specific to my research)
How your course works related to the research I'm interested?

title: Director of Project Management Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: It took forever from the application submission to finally get some feedback.  But once the screening was done the process moved quickly.  There were three stages: initial application screening, phone screening, then in-person interview.
Interview Questions: What factors are crucial within an organization and must be present for you to work most effectively?

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: I read about the PI's lab on his website and asked via email if I could join his team as an undergraduate research assistant. He invited me for a 30 minute in person interview, during which we discussed what type of research he typically does and what my responsibilities would consist of, if I were to be hired.
Interview Questions: What about the research interested you to apply to join the team?

title: Co-chair Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: Interview was with Assistant dean and three student leaders. We sat in a conference room and they took turns asking questions about the role and my skills and experience in leadership positions. The questions were reasonable and we discussed the role I was going to play if hired.
Interview Questions: Describe a situation where you took charge and handled a problem effectively and successfully.

title: Graduate Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: Talked with 5-8 professors during the 2 day interview. There were events on the first day and second day as well. There was a lot of interaction with the current students.
Interview Questions: Talk about your research

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: The interview was quick and to the point. The employer asked about previous experiences and wanted to know specific details that were on the resume. The employer also wanted to know the employee's expectations for the job (i.e. what they hope to learn, why they applied, etc.). Employer also wanted to know expected duration in the position.
Interview Questions: Further details on skills and experiences, also what I would like to learn from the job

title: Programmer/Analyst II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: Applied through the job board, took two weeks and got an email from HR to come in for an interview. Talked to HR representative, director, and technical lead. Nothing tricky or out of the ordinary, they want to know whether your skills and previous work will meet their current demands. They mostly asked about projects on resume and whether I had knowledge or experience with the technology they were working on(either programming language/framework/libraries)
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself

title: Postdoctoral Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in Oct 2011
Interview Descriptions: Quite standard academic postdoc interview. I was asked to give a talk on my PhD work. I had some interesting questions during the talk, and afterwards I met my prospective PI, lab mates, as well as briefly with my division's Head of Basic Biology and postdocs working for other PIs in the division.
Interview Questions: I was asked clearly if I would like to pursue academic research or of I was interested in going to industry.

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: Very chill interview, almost something informal. I was offered the job on the spot. They were very excited to hire someone with more than one language. I started my paperwork right away and started the week after.
Interview Questions: what was my background in any office environment

title: Postdoctoral Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: I talked with the lab PI over the phone, then he flew me out for an in person interview. I gave a presentation, met with everyone in the lab, and met with him one on one. It was fine.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have?

title: Laboratory Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in Jul 2011
Interview Descriptions: Found the job online through port triton and got a response fairly quickly. Many labs on campus hire on a need basis so they will respond relatively quickly if you apply one or two days after they post the job. Interview was very straightforward, asked standard questions. Found out within a week if I got the job.
Interview Questions: What is your biggest weakness?

title: Teacher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: Application submitted online through UCSD job board.  Selected candidates interviewed by a panel that includes a couple of administrators and one or two teachers.   Then asked to do a demo lesson with one of the classes of students (30-40 minutes).  If offered a position, references are contacted.  Fingerprints and transcripts are required before hiring.
Interview Questions: What is your experience working with underrepresented students?

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: They are so concerned with "diversity" that they require large, intimidating groups of people drawn from both sexes and all races, but then they don't know a thing about the job. You try and ask your painstakingly prepared questions about the job and they haven't a clue what the answer is.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: MFT Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: U C S D works with USD and you are interviewed through that university. It is typically a group interview followed by individual interviews. You are asked about your experiences and the reason you are seeking a clinical position as a trainee/intern working in medical family therapy and with doctors and nurses.
Interview Questions: What are your collaborative care experiences?

title: Program Assistant I Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: Worked at UCSD as a student, applied for jobs through the UCSD Job Portal. Had an interview with a panel of employees from my department. Straightforward as I already knew all of them. The position was basically opened for me, although there were several other people interviewed. UCSD is like that sometimes...
Interview Questions: Why do you want this job?

title: Graduate Student Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: Meeting professors at various times and locations. Some one on one and sometimes informal meetings with groups. They spend a decent amount of time trying to recruit you and sell you on the program. Is a nice payed for trip to San Diego.
Interview Questions: What I would like to work on

title: Animal Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: It was very formal and professional.  They had two managers interviewing, who asked questions about my past experience and what I can bring to the company.  They read the questions from a sheet, and wrote down everything I said.  It was very quiet and and a little bit nerve wrecking.
Interview Questions: What do I see myself doing in 5 years?  What are your views on animal research?

title: Mid Level Database Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions:
I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 weeks – interviewed at UCSD in March 2009.
A phone screening interview, followed by second round interviews at the San Diego office.
Interview Questions: First started off with about a 20 min call from HR. She just dived in asking questions, and provide oversight on the company and position.

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: Applied using Tritonlink. Was contacted via email to set up an in-person interview. Got asked typical questions like "Why are you applying to be an assistant here?" Fair interview, nothing unexpected.
Interview Questions: Do you have any previous lab experience?

title: BYA (Aquarium Instructor) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Mar 2011
Interview Descriptions: resume and 2-3 personal contacts; through UCSD job listings/postings; University clears you first before Aquarium receives your resumes and calls for an interview; interview is usually done with the Education Coordinator and/or Specialists which are the people above you
Interview Questions: Design a game or activity for kids on the spot.

title: Grad Student In Electrical Engineering Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: Each Professor will have different requirements for grad students. Professors will usually look for someone who obtained good grades in their classes and who shows interest in their research. If you read the Professor's research papers and show interest and competency he will probably be interested in hiring you.
Interview Questions: Questions about his research papers.

title: Residential Dining Food Service Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: There were no interview involved. The "interview" was a packet in which you can fill out and return back to management for review. Pretty much you get hired on the spot when you go in and ask for openings. It would expedite the process if you were referred by an employee.
Interview Questions: Would you be able to start immediately?

title: Student Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was quite brief. They took me to a seated area next to the elevators and began asking about my experiences at UC San Diego, the classes that I took, why I wanted to be a lab assistant, and asked a majority of behavioral questions. After the interview, I didn't get a response until 6 months later, which was kind of odd. I'm assuming they initially hired the first person they interviewed and needed an additional lab assistant a couple of months after that and decided to hire me.
Interview Questions: What are the three steps of PCR

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, then after several weeks got a call to interview in person.  I had a group interview with 3 PhDs and 1 MD.  The MD was constantly answering the cellphone.  I felt like I led the interview instead of being interviewed.
Interview Questions: Would transitioning from a large group to a smaller one be an issue?

title: Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: Very to the point and approachable. I first had a phone screening process. I was then brought in to fix a computer with serious operating system corruption and was told to write down the steps I took to solve these issues. As I solved these issues, the operations coordinator watched over my shoulder to see the steps i took.
Interview Questions: Please respond to us as if we were your customers. Proceeded to play the role as a student calling to solve an internet connectivity issue.

title: College Ambassador Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in Nov 2010
Interview Descriptions:
Group Interview 
-Everyone is asked to give an individual introduction of themselves as they might do while giving a tour
-Next asked to describe a feature of the school (housing and dining, academics etc) 
-Last is a situational question
Interview Questions: Situational question "A mother on you tour asks you: 'I hear when kids come to college they drink alcohol and have sex.' How would you respond to her question?"

title: Staff Research Associate II Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in Oct 2010
Interview Descriptions: It completely depends on the PI, if you're trying to work in the research field.  They will more than likely contact you directly through email and set up a 1:1.  If it's a staff job, this is usually pretty casual.  They just want to make sure you're not inept and you're excited about the position.  They'll also show you around the lab and introduce you to everyone who studies/works there.  Their approval is important, as well.  Make sure you ask a lot of questions about the position; a lot of times the job description will be very different from what you will actually end up doing.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your previous research.

title: Box Office Senior Event Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in Oct 2010
Interview Descriptions: Two interviews, one with general manager of UCSD Box Office, and one with head of the entire student affairs department. Both interviews took around half an hour, and required essentially experience with management/a skill they can utilize for something else, i.e. website.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with a customer who just won't say no to your company policy, without asking a manager?

title: Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in Sept 2010
Interview Descriptions: It's been a short-term job for 3 months, so the interview by primary employer was just a 30 min phone conversation and as I was told by staffing agency that they decided to hire me. Eventually, it appears that my criminal background was not satisfactory (DUI) and I was not offered the job.
Interview Questions: It's been a question about NGS (Next Generation Sequencing) and what I'm going to do as a first step given specific circumstances they have.

title: Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in Aug 2010
Interview Descriptions: I made a cold call to the company and they responded within a week with an interest to discuss the possibility of a hire.  They were clearly interested and ready for hiring.  I think that do the home work to find a interesting company which is ready to expand is most important.  Make it easy for them to like you and want you.  Avoid being complicated, like requiring a huge moving package or bonus.
Interview Questions: What job title do you need?

title: Development Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Jul 2010
Interview Descriptions: The interview process took over six months
Interview Questions: None, just the process was inefficient and stressful

title: Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in Jul 2010
Interview Descriptions: I was personally known based on my publications and my work presented publically at conferences, meetings and symposiums; also based on my past collaborative work -- joint proposals and grants from federal and local agencies.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Resnet Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in Jun 2010
Interview Descriptions: Three step process. They first screen your resume and check if you are qualified to provide exceptional customer service. The next stage is an phone interview to assess how well you can communicate over the phone. The final stage is an on-site interview that is accompanied with a challenge. The process does take time but it fully evaluates your ability to troubleshoot, communicate and utilize the resources available to you.
Interview Questions: The interview over the phone was difficult because it assessed your ability to communicate.

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego in Jun 2010
Interview Descriptions: The process was straight forward and clear, there was no confusion and every questions was answered.  Communication was very open and the process was exactly as it was initially described.  Very professional demeanor yet still personable.
Interview Questions: Rules about regulations and policies that at times had gray areas were difficult questions but manageable.

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in May 2010
Interview Descriptions: Most interested in customer service and office experience.  Really looking for someone that will it well in the office
Interview Questions: What customer service experience have you had?

title: Biomeddical Sciences PhD Candidate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions: The process consists of an initial application, followed by an invitation for a weekend long interview. This includes meeting with several faculty members. Each will ask about personal interests and will be eager to share what they work on in their own lab. There is also a campus tour and some good food. Following recruitment many interviewees will be invited to matriculate.
Interview Questions: The majority of questions asked are not technical. The one I found most difficult to answer was why here? There are many excellent Universities where one can obtain a doctorate in the biomedical field. It is advisable to prepare a number of reasons why this particular university fits your needs better than any other.

title: Human Resources Assistant Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in Mar 2010
Interview Descriptions: I had a one-on-one interview with the HR Specialist. Although I was very nervous, the office environment seemed relaxed which made me feel more comfortable. When I came for the interview, the office was occupied at the moment so we interviewed in the food court. The person that interviewed was very polite and we pretty much interviewed while walking to the tables. She contacted me back in a few days and I begin working there within a week.
Interview Questions: You have no previous experience with HR. What skills can you bring to the job?

title: Financial Management Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in Jan 2010
Interview Descriptions:
Phone interview to ask about previous employment and salary expectation.
2 onsites testing personality and how the candidate handles different situations
Interview Questions: What do you think is good customer service?

title: IT/Mac Support Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in Nov 2009
Interview Descriptions: Applied through Port Triton, got an email for me to meet at their offices. The interview consisted of 4 people interviewing me, one asking mainly about networking experience, but others mostly about Mac experience. Asked me general questions about what applications I used the most often, which applications were in Adobe CS Suite, how would I go about troubleshooting a theoretical problem with a customer, what would I do in case of hard disk failure etc.
Interview Questions: A user gets an error when trying to open a corrupt Word document, how do you go about solving this?

title: Administrative Support (EAOP) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in Sept 2009
Interview Descriptions:
I was interviewed by three different administrators in EAOP (Early Academic Outreach
Program) for an administrative support position. I knew this was going a competitive position going in because I was told that over 300 persons had applied for this position in just a matter of two days. I was also told that 10 people (including myself) were being interviewed for one position. Keep in mind that this position pays barely above minimum wage.
The interview lasted about 15 minutes.
Interview Questions: Why do you feel you are qualified for this job?

title: Programmer Analyst II Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC San Diego (San Diego, CA) in Apr 2009
Interview Descriptions: Requested to answer a series of questions regarding design and maintenance of computer systems supporting computational biology and bioinformatic analysis. Also, asked to comment on popular bioinformatic analysis techniques and familiarity with software packages such as BioPerl and BioPyhton. Final question asked to give an overview of ChIP-seq analysis, starting with a description of the high throughput sequence technology to the downstream integration of multiple datasets.
Interview Questions: Out line the steps in data question from the GAII high throughput sequencer.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in Apr 2009
Interview Descriptions: Interview was with academic coordinator and was fairly informal probably because I had extensive tutoring experience in the language. The coordinator explained the methodology used by the linguistics department in teaching its classes and asked some questions about my experience that indicated that the coordinator was looking for information about whether or not I was on board with the methodology. The interview was done in the language I would teach, but overall, it was pretty low stress. If I were interviewing, I would think of examples of teaching exercises used in the past and emphasize practical use of the language for students as the goal.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your previous teaching experiences.

title: Administrative Assistant III Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in Nov 2008
Interview Descriptions: I was referred by another Staffing Agency and they called me immediately...I then began the long process of filling out their online application, then interview and testing on computer. Then the long background checking along with fingerprinting. When there was a matched position, I attended an in-person Orientation and then told where to report.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to accept a temporary position?

title: Ra Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UC San Diego (La Jolla, CA) in Jun 2007
Interview Descriptions: Application process, you apply to grad school, they review the application and you get an admit/reject based on that. They look for GPA, publications and strong reco letters.
Interview Questions: writing the SOP
